question: why was i charged more than expected?

question: quanto tempo occorre per inviare denaro con transferwise?

una volta creato un trasferimento transferwise, visualizzerai la data stimata per il trasferimento. prima di inviare il bonifico, assicurati sempre che i dati del beneficiario siano corretti. se il trasferimento transferwise non va a buon fine, ti invieremo un messaggio push al riguardo. l‚Äôimporto ritorner√† sul tuo conto pochi giorni dopo. non √® possibile annullare personalmente un bonifico, ma se avrai bisogno di farlo potrai metterti in contatto con il supporto transferwise, che lo far√† per te. tieni presente che il trasferimento pu√≤ essere annullato solo fino a quando transferwise non ha movimentato i tuoi fondi. una volta che il denaro √® stato inviato al destinatario, non √® pi√π possibile cancellare il bonifico.
 
i dettagli del destinatario possono essere modificati solo prima che transferwise elabori il tuo bonifico e trasferisca il denaro. dopo che i tuoi soldi sono stati spostati, i dettagli del destinatario non possono pi√π essere modificati. se avessi bisogno di assistenza, ti consigliamo di metterti in contatto con il supporto di transferwise. transferwise non addebita alcuna commissione extra in caso di pagamento restituito e nemmeno noi. tuttavia, alcune banche partecipanti addebitano commissioni, nel qual caso transferwise detrarr√† tale importo dal denaro restituito conformemente alle relative condizioni di utilizzo(nuova tabella). ragioni comuni del mancato trasferimento: errore nei dettagli del trasferimento (ad es. quando si inseriscono il nome del destinatario o le informazioni del conto).caratteri speciali o troppi caratteri nel nome del destinatario o nel campo di riferimento.limiti raggiunti o pagamenti online non attivi nelle impostazioni della carta.non sono possibili trasferimenti in valuta estera con il conto n26 business or n26 business you o se il destinatario √® un conto business.

question: how can i download my monthly statements?

question: how to protect my account?

question: how to protect my identity?
answer: to protect and help avoid the misuse of your personal data, please keep in mind that: we will never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. this includes verifications for apartment rental contracts, lines of credit, or job offers (including jobs with n26). only complete the verification process if you want to open an n26 bank account for yourself.as the account owner, only you should create and have access to your login details. never create an n26 bank account with a predefined email address and password. if you use login credentials that were given to you, these credentials may be used to reach your personal and legal information. also, never log into an n26 account that is not yours.do not send your id or passport to unknown or unverified recipients.we may ask for certain documents when your transaction is subject to a routine check. only send valid documentation to verified n26 email accounts.we will never ask for your username, password, or pin codes outside the n26 app. never provide this information in an external website or app, even if it looks n26-related. if you ever feel in doubt, have received a suspicious request from a third party, or think your n26 login may be compromised, please do not hesitate to contact us.

question: where does n26 invest my money?
answer: we strive to provide our clients‚Äô deposits for loans to our customers (provided that they have the appropriate credit rating). for the liquidity not required in the customer business, our investment strategy is low in risk. we invest our customers‚Äô money at short notice with the deutsche bundesbank and other european banks in the eurozone with only good risk classes. and we refinance public-law customers mainly in germany (cities and municipalities) and invest in euro government bonds. we‚Äôre not a trading book institute. that is: we do not trade for short-term profit. and we don‚Äôt engage in speculation, whether on food, foreign exchange, bitcoins or other asset classes.

question: why can‚Äôt i get a loan?

question: can i have my pension credited to my n26 account?
answer:
n26 bank gmbh - sign-ups before 26/03/2020 with german iban having your pension credited to your n26 account is very simple.
this is what you need to do:  fill out online and sign the form provided by inps;after filling out and signing the form, please send it to support@n26.com via email (please remember to use your registered email account to send the form).  we will fill out the rest of the form and send it back to you in a few days.
please note that you might find references to citibank n.a in the form. citibank n.a is an  intermediary bank that credits inps pensions to bank accounts located abroad.  n26 bank gmbh, italian branch - sign-ups after and including 26/03/2020 with italian iban unfortunately, at the moment it is not possible to receive pension to the n26 account for customers with an italian iban. we will update all our customers and provide additional details and instructions as soon as the service is available. in case you encounter payment delays please contact our customer support via chat.

question: why did my online purchase fail?
answer: an online payment can fail for several reasons. here are some of the most common reasons: your account is low on funds. don‚Äôt forget to check your balance before making an online purchase. your balance must be greater than the total purchase amount. the card settings in the mobile application don‚Äôt allow online payments. we recommend that you check your card settings in your n26 application before making an online purchase. to do this:log into the mobile application.tap on ‚Äúactions‚Äù.tap on "card settings."ensure that the toggle button is set to enable ‚Äúonline payments‚Äù. you have set the limit on your card to be too low. log into the mobile application.tap on "actions".tap on ‚Äúcard settings‚Äù.tap on ‚Äúlimits‚Äù. check the ‚Äúdaily payment limit‚Äù on your card and adjust it if necessary. note: this limit cannot be raised above $5,000/day. there is also a maximum cumulative 30-day limit (cumulative total of all pos, atm and other withdrawals every 30-day period) of $30,000.you made a purchase on a website that doesn‚Äôt accept debit cards. check the information provided by the website itself. it might only accept credit cards and not debit cards. if that is the case, you will not be able to use your n26 visa card.

question: why didn't an atm give me cash?
answer: it happens: you go to an atm doesn‚Äôt give you cash and, and in some cases, the amount is still deducted from your account. first, check your card limits in your card settings and make sure atm withdrawals are active.make sure that you personal limits are set higher than the amount you want to withdraw.please be aware that you can only withdraw as many funds as you have deposited on your account. otherwise, if you don‚Äôt have an overdraft, the withdrawal will be rejected.the fixed maximum daily (24 hours rolling) limit for withdrawals is 2500‚Ç¨. some atms have their own limits in place, so it can happen that you can‚Äôt withdraw your daily limit at once. if you didn‚Äôt receive cash from the atm, but the amount was still charged from your account, we‚Äôre happy to help you: the amount that was deducted from your balance is only an authorization, meaning that the amount is blocked or reserved to be debited by the merchant. when the merchant debits the amount, it‚Äôs called a settlement of the transaction. if your transaction was not successful the authorization normally expires within a matter of hours - or a maximum of 12 working days - and is then automatically credited to your account again. only in case the transaction has been settled we can charge back the amount from the merchant. you can see whether a transaction has been settled when it appears on your downloadable monthly statement (not only in your transaction list in the app). this means: if the amount appears on your monthly statement and/or hasn‚Äôt been credited back to your account after 12 working days, you can file a chargeback with us. in the meantime, we suggest you try another atm from a different operator. this rarely happens twice in a row.

te aseguramos que vamos a tomar todas las medidas necesarias para asistirte en esta situaci√≥n. adem√°s de nuestras obligaciones legales para la prevenci√≥n del fraude y con miras a mejorar continuamente nuestras defensas de seguridad, contamos con un equipo especializado que analiza cada caso de fraude individualmente. los casos de fraude en s√≠ suelen ser relativamente complicados y requieren un trato detallado. seg√∫n la complejidad del caso, puede tomar desde un par de d√≠as hasta varias semanas. por √∫ltimo, si tienes pruebas o fuertes sospechas de que han podido hackear tu cuenta, te recomendamos que tambi√©n pongas una denuncia en la polic√≠a. para m√°s informaci√≥n sobre c√≥mo protegemos tu cuenta en caso de fraude, visita nuestro art√≠culo del blog(pesta√±a nueva). echa un vistazo tambi√©n a nuestra p√°gina sobre la seguridad en n26(pesta√±a nueva) para ver nuestro compromiso por proteger tu dinero y tu cuenta. nuestras l√≠neas est√°n abiertas todos los d√≠as de 07:00 a 23:00, domingos y festivos incluidos.  si no tienes acceso a la app de tu m√≥vil ni a la webapp, tambi√©n puedes pedir que bloqueemos tu tarjeta o tu cuenta llamando al +34 910 480 660.

question: what are ‚Äúmessages from n26‚Äù ?
answer: the security of your personal data is our priority. that‚Äôs why we created an inbox in the n26 app that allows us to share any communication. any content that includes personal data is communicated in messages from n26. we‚Äôll still use your email address to communicate general information. personal data is any information that relates to you as a person and identifies or could possibly identify you. it could be your account details, your address (email or postal), id documents, proof of residence, but also the notification about your accrued overdraft interest or your monthly standing order. when we send you a message to message from n26, you‚Äôll receive a push notification on your paired smartphone and an email to your registered email address. once connected to the webapp, you‚Äôll also be notified by an info card of any new messages. we‚Äôll send you a message that you can find in your messages from n26, and ask that you reply directly from there. this feature is available from both the n26 app and the webapp under my account -> support -> messages from n26. make sure you downloaded the latest app version.  you can‚Äôt initiate a conversation, but you‚Äôll be able to reply as soon as we send you the first message. if you need to provide us with a document, simply select add attachment. please make sure that the total file size of your attachments per message doesn‚Äôt exceed 25mb.    messages from n26 doesn‚Äôt replace our chat and you can still send us an email. if you need to get in touch with us first, visit our page how to contact n26? if we need to verify you, we‚Äôll ask you to open a chat with us.

question: how does spaces work?
answer: set goals, create and personalize spaces, and transfer money between them instantly. spaces is available in the mobile and webapp(new tab). in addition to your main account (or primary space), you can create and delete additional spaces as often as you‚Äôd like but the number of active spaces at any one time depends on your account type: 2 additional spaces with an n26 or n26 business account or up to 10 additional spaces with n26 you, n26 business you and n26 metal.your primary account statements will include all transactions sent to a space or received from one. you can download balance statements from the confirmation page.only your primary space can be negative (if you are eligible for an overdraft). all other balances in spaces cannot be negative, meaning you can only transfer what is available in a particular space.you can only use the balance from your primary space toward your mastercard transactions. so consider transferring money before making a purchase if needed.move money from one space to another by holding down on your main account and dragging and dropping into your space. once the amount is confirmed the balance is updated right away.you can lock and unlock a space at anytime from your mobile and web app. you‚Äôll only need to confirm with your confirmation pin. if a space is locked, you‚Äôll still be able to transfer money to it. if you need to withdraw money from a locked space, you need first to unlock it.you‚Äôll be able to hide the amount within the space from your account‚Äôs total balance. just go into your space, tap the three dots in the top right corner and select ‚Äòhide space balance‚Äô. spaces includes a feature called rules which will help you manage your time and your finances effectively. want to tell your friends about us and earn some money? get ‚Ç¨15 for each friend that you successfully refer to n26. learn more about our refer a friend program.

question: why did my transferwise account linking fail?
answer: we are sorry that you cannot currently link your existing transferwise account. the most common reason why this could have happened is due to incomplete personal details on your transferwise account.  if you have set up an account in the past directly with transferwise using the same email address as that registered on your n26 account, and you did not fill out all personal details, we will not be able to link your account within n26.  please log into your transferwise account at www.transferwise.com/login(new tab), or via their app, and ensure that your full name, address, date of birth and phone number are complete.  if you cannot remember your password, go to www.transferwise.com/login(new tab) and select ‚Äòforgot password‚Äô to reset your password and access your account. if you cannot remember creating an account with transferwise, you should still try to log in by resetting your password. it could be that it was created via another partner or some time ago.

question: am i liable to tax in the united states?
answer:
as a licensed bank we‚Äôre required to report directly to the irs information about financial accounts held by u.s. taxpayers according to fatca, a legislation designed by the us department of treasury and the u.s. internal revenue service to encourage better tax compliance by preventing u.s. persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid u.s. taxation on their income and assets. you can find more information about fatca here(new tab).  in the context of fatca, a u.s. person is defined as, among other things: a citizen of the united states (including dual citizens)a resident in the united states, for example as a holder of a valid u.s. green card or as a person who passes the ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù (see below). if you‚Äôre unsure as to how to determine whether you‚Äôre a u.s. person, please consult a tax advisor. ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù means: that you‚Äôve been physically present in the u.s. 183 days or more in the current calendar year or that you have been physically present in the u.s. 183 days or more over the last three calendar years, to be calculated as follows: 
 
(31 days or more in the current calendar year) + (the number of days physically present in the u.s. last year) divided by 3 + (the number of days physically present in the u.s. the year before last) divided by 6.  in addition, if your account shows any of the following: u.s. citizenship or u.s. residenceu.s. place of birthu.s. mailing or residence address, including u.s. po boxesu.s. telephone numberstanding instructions to a u.s. address or an account maintained in the us we‚Äôre still obliged to treat you as a u.s. person, unless we receive the following from you:  a w-8ben or similar agreed self-certification form anda non-u.s. passport or other government-issued identification evidencing your citizenship or nationality in a country other than the u.s.in case you were born in the us, a copy of your certificate of loss of nationality of the us.

question: am i liable to tax in the united states?
answer:
as a licensed bank we‚Äôre required to report directly to the irs information about financial accounts held by u.s. taxpayers according to fatca, a legislation designed by the us department of treasury and the u.s. internal revenue service to encourage better tax compliance by preventing u.s. persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid u.s. taxation on their income and assets. you can find more information about fatca here(new tab).  in the context of fatca, a u.s. person is defined as, among other things: a citizen of the united states (including dual citizens)a resident in the united states, for example as a holder of a valid u.s. green card or as a person who passes the ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù (see below). if you‚Äôre unsure as to how to determine whether you‚Äôre a u.s. person, please consult a tax advisor. ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù means: that you‚Äôve been physically present in the u.s. 183 days or more in the current calendar year or that you have been physically present in the u.s. 183 days or more over the last three calendar years, to be calculated as follows: 
 
(31 days or more in the current calendar year) + (the number of days physically present in the u.s. last year) divided by 3 + (the number of days physically present in the u.s. the year before last) divided by 6.  in addition, if your account shows any of the following: u.s. citizenship or u.s. residenceu.s. place of birthu.s. mailing or residence address, including u.s. po boxesu.s. telephone numberstanding instructions to a u.s. address or an account maintained in the us we‚Äôre still obliged to treat you as a u.s. person, unless we receive the following from you:  a w-8ben or similar agreed self-certification form anda non-u.s. passport or other government-issued identification evidencing your citizenship or nationality in a country other than the u.s.in case you were born in the us, a copy of your certificate of loss of nationality of the us.

question: psd2 - secure open banking
answer:
payment services directive 2 (‚Äúpsd2‚Äù) is a revised european directive allowing you to access your account information and initiate payments through regulated third-party providers in a safe and secure manner. 
 
this means that you can permit regulated third party providers to access your account information through a dedicated interface:  you can enable an account information service (ais) to pull together data from different bank accounts you may have, and then aggregate and manage their details in the same place through certified third-party providers.you can securely pay at the checkout of any website that offers payment initiation services (pis).  the data exchange is handled in the background via our partner - token.io. if you begin using a third-party payment service like an account information service or a payment initiation service, you‚Äôll be redirected to your n26 app via token.io to confirm the access request. in our privacy policy(new tab) we inform you about the purposes, involved parties and legal bases of the necessary data processing involved to fulfil our obligations as part of the revised european payment services directive. faqs if a third party provider has not integrated with our dedicated interface, the third party provider will need to integrate with our dedicated interface via our partner token.io. you need to contact the respective third party provider and revoke the access permission directly with them.  *applies to all countries in the eea.

question: how long do transfers take?
answer: all domestic and international incoming sepa transfers are instant if they come from a bank that supports instant transfers and the sender selects this option. banking regulation applies to sepa instant transfers and may delay the transfer in case it needs additional monitoring e.g. when sending large amounts of money. in case the sending bank doesn‚Äôt offer instant transfers or the sender doesn‚Äôt choose this option, all sepa transfers should arrive within a maximum of 2 working days.  please note that outgoing sepa transfers are completed within one banking day. if the transfer is not instant, keep in mind that if a transfer has been made right before a weekend or bank holiday, the time frame will be extended. we send our sepa payment orders through target2(new tab). it‚Äôs open to process payments every working day from 07:00 to 18:00 cet. the system is closed on the following days: 1 january (new year‚Äôs day)good friday, easter monday1 may (labour day)25 december (christmas day)26 december. with moneybeam, you can transfer money to other n26 customers instantly and you can also receive instant moneybeam requests from banks that support instant transfers. times vary for foreign currency transfers with transferwise (but you‚Äôll see an estimated transfer time on the quote screen). you‚Äôll need to confirm each type of transfer via push message in the app before we send anything out. please note: we only accept transfers in eur via sepa (that means no swift transfers). if your incoming transfer is outside of these estimated time frames, please contact the sender (bank) for a payment investigation. we can‚Äôt investigate incoming transfers.

question: how to order my card with express delivery?
answer: express delivery is a good option if you need your card in a hurry or if postal deliveries have sometimes failed to reach you for whatever reason. you‚Äôll be given the option to select express delivery when choosing a delivery method for your first card or if you reorder a card. you‚Äôll then receive a tracking link by email. if you‚Äôre not home during the delivery and your mailbox can‚Äôt be accessed, the card will be left at a nearby access point (you can find it through the provided tracking link). the card only stays at the access point for a limited amount of time. after that, it‚Äôll be returned to us. we‚Äôll inform you by email if that happens. if you order via express delivery, keep in mind that: your new standard, n26 you or metal mastercard will be delivered within 2-3 working days. deliveries take place between 08:00 and 12:00. deliveries can be made by dhl express to all of our supported countries within europe. it‚Äôs currently not possible to make deliveries to other countries.it‚Äôs not possible to cancel or change an express delivery once it‚Äôs been selected as the delivery method.to close an account, you must pay for the express delivery of your card. if your card hasn‚Äôt arrived within 3-5 working days of placing your order, please check the tracking link for an update. you can also use the tracking link to inform dhl directly about the details of your delivery address or to redirect the shipment if you can‚Äôt be there at the time of delivery. n26 standard and n26 you cards have a fee of ‚Ç¨10 for standard shipping and ‚Ç¨30 for express shipping (which includes the ‚Ç¨10 card replacement fee).

question: why do i pay the church tax?

question: fatca - why we require certain information from our customers
answer:
as a financial institution, n26 is required to report information about financial accounts held by u.s. taxpayers or by foreign entities (in which u.s. taxpayers hold a substantial ownership interest according to fatca) to the united states department of treasury and the internal revenue service (‚Äúirs‚Äù). fatca is an acronym for foreign account tax compliance act and is a legislation designed to prevent tax evasion. another purpose of fatca is to encourage better tax compliance by preventing u.s. persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid u.s. taxation on their income and assets. you can find more information about fatca on the irs website(new tab). the u.s. tax system includes u.s. citizens who are not presently residing in the u.s. in comparison. so in order for us to be able to accurately determine whether your account is to be reported to the irs, we‚Äôll need to ask you: are you (also) a citizen or green card holder of the united states? 
are you subject to tax in the u.s?

being ‚Äúsubject to tax‚Äù in the u.s. does not necessarily mean that you‚Äôre also paying personal income tax in the u.s. it means that u.s. tax law requires you to file a tax return and declare your (worldwide) income to the irs, even if you don‚Äôt end up paying any u.s. tax.
if so, what is your u.s. taxpayer identification number?

as a u.s. tin you can either use your u.s. social security number (‚Äússn‚Äù) or your u.s. individual taxpayer identification number (itin). you can find more information about tin on the irs‚Äô website(new tab). additionally, if your account shows: a u.s. place of birth, a u.s. telephone number,a standing order to the u.s. then we are required by fatca legislation to initially assume that you are subject to fatca until you can specifically confirm to us otherwise. in case your circumstances change, you can always update your tax information in the n26 app. to do this, simply log in to the n26 app and go to: my account > settings > personal settings > tax information

question: how to reorder a card?

question: warum hat mir ein geldautomat kein bargeld ausgezahlt?
answer: es kann passieren: ein geldautomat zahlt dir kein bargeld aus und in manchen f√§llen wird dein konto trotzdem belastet. pr√ºfe zun√§chst deine kartenlimits in deinen karteneinstellungen und stelle sicher, dass bargeldabhebungen aktiviert sind. √ºberpr√ºfe auch, dass dein individuell einstellbares limit f√ºr bargeldabhebungen mindestens so hoch ist, wie der betrag, den du abheben wolltest. beachte, dass du nur soviel geld abheben kannst, wie du guthaben auf deinem konto hast. wenn du keinen dispokredit hast, wird die abhebung sonst abgelehnt.das maximal einstellbare tageslimit liegt bei 2500‚Ç¨ pro 24 stunden. dennoch haben viele automaten ihre eigene limits, sodass es vorkommen kann, dass du an einem automaten nicht dein ganzes tageslimit auf einmal abheben kannst. falls du vom automaten kein geld erhalten hast, aber dein konto trotzdem belastet wurde, helfen wir dir gerne weiter: der betrag, der von deinem guthaben abgezogen wurde, ist zun√§chst einmal nur eine autorisierung, d.h. eine reservierung oder ein gesperrter betrag. da die transaktion nicht erfolgreich war, verf√§llt dieser reservierte betrag normalerweise nach wenigen stunden - maximal 12 werktagen - und wird deinem konto wieder gutgeschrieben. nur wenn der betrag tats√§chlich abgebucht wird, k√∂nnen wir ihn reklamieren. der betrag gilt erst als abgebucht, wenn er auf deinen herunterladbaren kontoausz√ºgen erscheint, (nicht nur in der umsatzanzeige in der app). das bedeutet: wenn der betrag auf deinen herunterladbaren kontoausz√ºgen erscheint und/oder nach 12 werktagen noch nicht deinem konto wieder gutgeschrieben wird, helfen wir dir gerne dabei, den betrag zu reklamieren. bis dahin empfehlen wir dir, es mit einem geldautomaten eines anderen geldinstituts zu versuchen. es ist sehr selten, dass auszahlungen zweimal hintereinander fehlschlagen.

question: come posso creare regole per i miei spaces?
answer: nell‚Äôambito dei tuoi spaces puoi decidere le tue regole: puoi preimpostare trasferimenti periodici verso i tuoi spaces e risparmiare tempo e denaro in modo molto semplice. se vuoi impostare una regola dalla webapp, effettua un bonifico con spaces e poi seleziona ‚Äúripeti questa operazione‚Äù. per cancellare una regola, clicca sui 3 puntini indicanti le impostazioni. da l√¨, vedrai tutte le regole attive. clicca sull‚Äôicona del cestino per cancellare la regola. se vuoi modificare una regola esistente, puoi semplicemente eliminarla dalle impostazioni dello space in cui l‚Äôhai creata e crearne una nuova.  dai dispositivi android effettua un bonifico e seleziona ‚Äúripeti questa operazione‚Äù. in alternativa, dalla sezione spaces, seleziona i tre puntini e poi ‚Äúcrea regola‚Äù. da questo punto, segui i passaggi successivi fino a confermare le informazioni inserite. dai dispositivi ios, entra nella sezione spaces e seleziona ‚Äúcrea regola‚Äù. baster√† inserire le informazioni richieste e confermare.  ti informiamo, inoltre, che le regole per i tuoi spaces ed eventuali ordini di bonifici verranno elaborati allo stesso orario (0100 utc) se impostate per lo stesso giorno. accertati di avere fondi sufficienti per coprire queste transazioni ed evitare che non vengano eseguite.  se non riesci a coprire l‚Äôimporto richiesto, baster√† impostare le transazioni in date differenti in base alle tue priorit√†.

question: how to top up my account?
answer: once you are successfully verified, you‚Äôll be able to top up your account in several ways. to do so, simply go to the n26 app and select ‚Äôadd money‚Äô to see the available options: 1. sepa transfer (up to 2 business days): the transfer must be in eur and within the sepa zone.you will need to provide your iban and your name as it is written on the id you used to create your account.if you have a business account, please keep in mind that we do not accept company names. 2. debit or credit card (instant): you can choose to deposit between 20‚Ç¨ and 150‚Ç¨.the first deposit is free. the following deposits charge a fee of 3% of the deposit amount.simply enter the card details from the sending account. please note, prepaid cards and american express credit cards are not accepted. 3. apple pay or google pay (instant): you can choose to deposit between 20‚Ç¨ and 150‚Ç¨.the first deposit is free. the following deposits charge a fee of 3% of the deposit amount.simply enter the card details (credit or debit) linked to the apple pay or google pay account. please note, prepaid cards and american express credit cards are not accepted. 4. moneybeam (instant): you can receive money from other n26 users. 5. cash26 (instant): available in germany, austria and italy.deposit cash through our partner stores once your card is activated and with your paired device.

question: how can i pay bills and top-up my phone from the app?

question: what are ‚Äúmessages from n26‚Äù ?
answer: the security of your personal data is our priority. that‚Äôs why we created an inbox in the n26 app that allows us to share any communication. any content that includes personal data is communicated in messages from n26. we‚Äôll still use your email address to communicate general information. personal data is any information that relates to you as a person and identifies or could possibly identify you. it could be your account details, your address (email or postal), id documents, proof of residence, but also the notification about your accrued overdraft interest or your monthly standing order. when we send you a message to message from n26, you‚Äôll receive a push notification on your paired smartphone and an email to your registered email address. once connected to the webapp, you‚Äôll also be notified by an info card of any new messages. we‚Äôll send you a message that you can find in your messages from n26, and ask that you reply directly from there. this feature is available from both the n26 app and the webapp under my account -> support -> messages from n26. make sure you downloaded the latest app version.  you can‚Äôt initiate a conversation, but you‚Äôll be able to reply as soon as we send you the first message. if you need to provide us with a document, simply select add attachment. please make sure that the total file size of your attachments per message doesn‚Äôt exceed 25mb.    messages from n26 doesn‚Äôt replace our chat and you can still send us an email. if you need to get in touch with us first, visit our page how to contact n26? if we need to verify you, we‚Äôll ask you to open a chat with us.

question: how to use google pay?
answer: applies to germany, spain, italy, ireland, belgium, slovakia, france, denmark, finland, sweden, norway, poland and switzerland.  google pay is a payment method that allows you to pay with your smartphone so you don‚Äôt have to carry your mastercard with you all the time. google pay is available in all shops supporting contactless (nfc) payments as well as online shops. hold your smartphone near the contactless terminal and your payment will automatically process. when paying online, select google pay as the payment option. we‚Äôll ask you to confirm your payment via push message during checkout. some tips to keep in mind: to add your n26 mastercard, download the google pay app and select get started to enter your card details. you‚Äôll need android 5.0 (lollipop) or higher as well as an nfc-capable smartphone.google pay requires a screen lock. if you didn‚Äôt set it up yet, you‚Äôll be asked to before adding your mastercard to the google pay app.if you‚Äôre protecting your smartphone with a case, you might have to remove it to pay. some payment terminals don‚Äôt recognize your phone if the case is too big.if the payment terminal asks you to present your card (again), you might have removed the smartphone too fast or didn‚Äôt hold it close enough. just try again while keeping this in mind.

question: top-up
answer:
with top-up, you can use a debit card (via manual entry, apple pay¬Æ, or google pay¬Æ) to instantly fund your account right from the n26 mobile application. this is the fastest way to add money to your n26 account.we charge no fees for your first transfer by this method, but we do charge a fee for subsequent such transfers. in addition, if the account associated with the funding debit card contains funds insufficient to cover the transfer, the debit card‚Äôs issuing bank may charge you an overdraft fee or decline the transfer. for more information, see below under ‚Äútop-up fees". how to use top-up after you complete verification of your id, you will see "add funds" on the main screen of the n26 mobile application. tap on this button to continue. (note: if you have already added funds to your n26 account by another method, on the main page of the application you will tap on "actions" and then "add money".)if you have enabled apple pay¬Æ or google pay¬Æ on your mobile device, in the "add money" window in the lower half of your screen, beneath "direct deposit" and "external bank transfer", you will see:"debit card transfer""apple pay¬Æ" 
or"google pay¬Æ"if you have not enabled apple pay¬Æ or google pay¬Æ on your mobile device, you will only see "debit card transfer" as a top-up option. if you select the "debit card transfer" option to fund your account, follow the on-screen guide to manually enter your debit card details and confirm your instant top-up. the transfer is immediate, and you should see the transfer reflected in your n26 account balance instantly! (note: you will not need to re-enter your debit card details if you perform a subsequent top-up with the same card later.)if you select the "apple pay¬Æ" or "google pay¬Æ" options to fund your account, follow the on-screen guides to confirm your instant top-up. the transfer is immediate, and you should see the transfer reflected in your n26 account balance instantly!please remember that we charge no fee only for your first top-up transfer. we charge the fees specified below for subsequent top-up transfers. (note: in cases where the transfer is refunded to the debit card‚Äôs issuing bank, we charge no additional fees to process the refund, but the original fee charged from the original transfer will not be returned to you.) top-up fees   top-up limits   frequently asked questions "i have already funded my n26 account by another method other than top-up. can i still use top-up to fund my account without incurring an n26 fee?" yes! if you have not used top-up to fund your account yet, we will not charge a fee for your first top-up transfer. "can i top-up my account once with a debit card for free, and then later top-up with apple pay¬Æ or google pay¬Æ for free as well?" no. if you fund your account for the first time by debit card (via manual entry, apple pay¬Æ, or google pay¬Æ), we will not charge you a fee. however, we will charge you a fee for any subsequent transfers by this method. please also keep in mind that, if the account associated with your funding debit card does not contain enough funds to cover the transfer, the debit card‚Äôs issuing bank may charge an overdraft fee or decline the transfer. "can i fund my account by the top-up method when using the webapp?" we are currently offering this option through the n26 mobile application only.  "is the $600 monthly limit applied on a rolling 30-day period or based on a calendar month?" it is based on a calendar month. "is there a limit to the number of top-ups that i can do within a month?" there is no limit to the number of top-ups that can be made within the month, as long as they do not exceed the monthly limit of $600. "if i choose to use a specific debit card for top-up, do i have to use the same debit card for subsequent such transfers?" you can add a maximum of five debit cards as funding options.  "what cards can i use to top-up my account?" only us debit cards will be accepted at this time. please do not use credit cards, prepaid cards, gift cards, or any cards issued by foreign banks.

question: why does n26 do checks on transactions?
answer:
we have the responsibility to run routine checks on accounts and transactions in order to ensure your account‚Äôs security (see gwg ¬ß 10(new tab)). these checks are automatically initiated by our systems.  as a result, we may ask you to provide some documents. if you receive such a request, please send the requested documents via messages from n26. there are no exceptions or evasion for such checks.  this practice is a standard banking procedure and ensures the safety of our customers. both the process and the result are confidential and handled internally. here are some tips to speed up the process: the document that we need you to provide will be exactly named in the message you‚Äôll receive from n26. you can send us scanned documents, pictures, or screenshots, as long as the original content of the document is easily readable. please make sure to also provide a detailed description. be precise in your answers, details, and documents. after we receive your required proof and description, we will let you know if your reply fulfills our check. in a few cases, we might ask for further clarification which could prolong the process.reply as soon as possible, always before the deadline stated in the message you received from n26. use that email to reply and send attachments. our customer support doesn‚Äôt have any additional information on this subject.you must provide valid documentation depending on your situation. 
 find here some examples: you‚Äôve received financial help from your family to complete projects or have inherited land or money from deceased relatives.
a granting/loan contract, an official document of inheritance, or an official document of the source of the loan (such as the sales documents of a sold property to finance the loan or bank statements of granting relatives).you‚Äôve sold a property or your shares on the stock market.
the contract showing the agreed transactions or the official notarial documentation of the transfer of property.you‚Äôve received or sent money to pay bills or buy a product.
documents showing the balance statements confirming the source of this money or documents showing the use of the money and its purpose.you‚Äôve received a final payout from your previous employer.
documents proving the end of your employment, detailing the payment and/or a bank statement from your previous employer.

question: warum konnte mein transferwise konto nicht verkn√ºpft werden?

question: why was i charged twice?
answer: we offer you banking in real-time. this means you‚Äôre able to see the processes going on behind your account that you otherwise wouldn‚Äôt see. there are two main transaction types that take place during an in-store or online purchase: authorizations. a block or reserved amount made by a retailer or merchant. this includes anything from your morning cup of coffee to hotel or car rental bookings (including security deposits).presentments. the actual amount that is deducted from your account. again, that cup of coffee is finally cleared from your account or you can get your security deposit back once that hotel room or car is returned safe and sound. once an authorization has been confirmed, we can‚Äôt cancel or reverse it. at that point, a few things can happen to your authorization: it turns into a presentment, it‚Äôs rejected, or it expires (and automatically returns to your account after 12 days at the latest. car rental deposits may need up to 30 days to return to your account). keep in mind: sometimes you‚Äôll see both the authorization and the presentment if they become disconnected or due to technical issues at the payment terminal. eventually the authorization will expire. if it doesn‚Äôt, we can help get your money back.verification authorizations (usually very small amounts) are used to check whether your card is active. this money will return to your account.the amount of an authorization can differ from the final presentment for a variety of reasons.

question: ¬ødebo declarar impuestos en estados unidos?
answer:
como banco con licencia legal, reportamos la informaci√≥n fiscal de las cuentas en estados unidos directamente al internal revenue service, de acuerdo con fatca, que es una legislaci√≥n dise√±ada por el departamento de tesorer√≠a y el irs de ee.uu. para incentivar el cumplimiento total de la ley de impuestos, previniendo que las personas de ee.uu. utilicen bancos extranjeros u otras organizaciones financieras con el objetivo de declarar sus bienes y ganancias. encuentra m√°s informaci√≥n sobre fatca (pesta√±a nueva)aqu√≠(pesta√±a nueva).  dentro del contexto de fatca, una persona de ee.uu. se define, entre otras cosas, como:  un ciudadano de los ee.uu. (incluidos los de doble nacionalidad)un residente en los ee.uu., por ejemplo el poseedor de la tarjeta verde, o alguien que cumple con el ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù (consulta que es a continuaci√≥n). si no est√°s seguro de si eres una persona de los ee.uu. puedes consultar a un asesor fiscal. ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù significa: que has estado f√≠sicamente en los ee.uu. 183 d√≠as o m√°s en el a√±o de calendario actual.  √≥ que has estado f√≠sicamente presente en los ee.uu. 183 d√≠as o m√°s en los tres √∫ltimos a√±os de calendario. para calcularlo, se hace de la siguiente forma: 
(31 d√≠as o m√°s en el a√±o de calendario actual) + (el n√∫mero de d√≠as con presencia f√≠sica en ee.uu. en el √∫ltimo a√±o) dividido entre 3 + ( el n√∫mero de d√≠as con presencia f√≠sica en ee.uu. en el pen√∫ltimo a√±o) dividido entre 6. adem√°s, si tu cuenta muestra algunos de los siguientes puntos: ciudadan√≠a o residencia en ee.uu.lugar de nacimiento en ee.uu. direcci√≥n de residencia en ee.uu. n√∫mero de tel√©fono de ee.uu.ordenes de transferencias o pagos permanentes a direcciones de ee.uu. si se cumplen esos requisitos, estamos obligados a tratarte como una persona de los estados unidos, a no ser que presentes lo siguiente: el formulario w-8ben o un documento similar yun pasaporte de otro pa√≠s que no sea ee.uu. u otro documento certificado por otro gobierno que muestre que tu nacionalidad es otra.si has nacido en ee.uu., un documento que certifique la perdida de tu nacionalidad estadounidense.

question: am i liable to tax in the united states?
answer:
as a licensed bank we‚Äôre required to report directly to the irs information about financial accounts held by u.s. taxpayers according to fatca, a legislation designed by the us department of treasury and the u.s. internal revenue service to encourage better tax compliance by preventing u.s. persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid u.s. taxation on their income and assets. you can find more information about fatca here(new tab).  in the context of fatca, a u.s. person is defined as, among other things: a citizen of the united states (including dual citizens)a resident in the united states, for example as a holder of a valid u.s. green card or as a person who passes the ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù (see below). if you‚Äôre unsure as to how to determine whether you‚Äôre a u.s. person, please consult a tax advisor. ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù means: that you‚Äôve been physically present in the u.s. 183 days or more in the current calendar year or that you have been physically present in the u.s. 183 days or more over the last three calendar years, to be calculated as follows: 
 
(31 days or more in the current calendar year) + (the number of days physically present in the u.s. last year) divided by 3 + (the number of days physically present in the u.s. the year before last) divided by 6.  in addition, if your account shows any of the following: u.s. citizenship or u.s. residenceu.s. place of birthu.s. mailing or residence address, including u.s. po boxesu.s. telephone numberstanding instructions to a u.s. address or an account maintained in the us we‚Äôre still obliged to treat you as a u.s. person, unless we receive the following from you:  a w-8ben or similar agreed self-certification form anda non-u.s. passport or other government-issued identification evidencing your citizenship or nationality in a country other than the u.s.in case you were born in the us, a copy of your certificate of loss of nationality of the us.

question: google pay
answer:
google pay is the fast, simple way to pay at millions of places ‚Äì onsite, in apps, and in stores. it brings together everything you need at checkout and protects your payment
information with multiple layers of security. it keeps everything you need in one secure place: credit and debit cardsticketsboarding passesloyalty cardsgift cards, and more. with google pay, your actual card number is never shared with merchants or stored on your device. instead, a device account number is used to process your payment. google pay protects your payment information with multiple layers of security, using one of the world‚Äôs most advanced security infrastructures to help keep your account safe. when you use your phone to pay contactless, your actual card number is never shared with merchants. instead, a device account number is used to process our payment. yes, you can add your n26 visa debit card to google pay. no you can add your n26 visa debit card to the google pay by following these simple steps: open google pay.tap get started.tap credit or debit card.tap continue.take a photo of the card.choose the method to verify you.tap continue.follow the instructions in the e-mail you have just received.your card is now linked. to use google pay in stores: the merchant needs to offer contactless / google pay as a payment method.wake up your android phone. (you don‚Äôt need to open the google pay application.)hold the back of your phone close to the payment reader for a few seconds.when you‚Äôre done paying a blue check mark will appear on the screen.if prompted, follow the instructions on the screen.  (some stores use older software that asks for a pin or signature.) to use google pay online or in an app: the online merchant needs to offer google pay as a payment method.at checkout, tap the google pay button.if asked, choose a payment method.enter your shipping address. you can add your n26 visa debit card to your smartwatch by following these simple steps: make sure that your watch:is running wear os by google.has nfc (near field communication).is connected to your phone via bluetooth. on your watch, open the google pay application. tap get started. set up screen lock (if you haven‚Äôt already). on your phone, follow instructions to add a credit or debit card.  note:  this only adds a card to the google pay app on your watch (not your phone). your card will show up on your watch. to use your smartwatch to pay for purchases:  launch the google pay application on your watch.  note:  the watch doesn‚Äôt need to be connected to your phone in order to make a payment.place the top edge of your watch to the payment terminal.when the payment is accepted you‚Äôll feel a long vibration on your watch.the payment terminal will likely also beep to confirm. you can request money via google pay by following these simple steps: open the google pay app.tap send on the bottom of the navigation bar.tap the blue send or request button.find the contact you are looking for.enter the amount you question: devo pagare le tasse negli stati uniti?
answer: in quanto banca autorizzata, siamo obbligati a riportare all‚Äôirs informazioni sui conti tenuti dai contribuenti statunitensi secondo le disposizioni fatca, una legislazione delineata dal us department of treasury e dal us internal revenue service con lo scopo di incoraggiare l‚Äôadempimento fiscale ed di impedire che i soggetti statunitensi si rivolgano a banche estere o altri enti creditizi per evitare la tassazione statunitense sulle loro entrate e sul loro patrimonio. troverai maggiori informazioni sulla normativa fatca (nuova tabella)qui(nuova tabella). nell‚Äôambito fatca, vengono definiti soggetti statunitensi, ad esempio: i cittadini degli stati uniti (inclusi i possessori di doppia cittadinanza)i residenti negli stati uniti (ad es. i possessori di un valido permesso di soggiorno per gli usa oppure le persone che superano il ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù - maggiori informazioni qui di seguito) se non sai se sei un soggetto statunitense, ti suggeriamo di rivolgerti ad un consulente fiscale. il ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù prevede che: tu sia stato fisicamente presente negli usa per almeno 183 giorni nell‚Äôanno solare in corso oppure tu sia stato fisicamente presente negli usa per almeno 183 giorni negli ultimi 3 anni solari, da calcolare nel seguente modo: (almeno 31 giorni nell‚Äôanno solare in corso) + (il numero di giorni di presenza fisica negli usa l‚Äôanno scorso) diviso per 3 + (il numero di giorni di presenza fisica negli usa l‚Äôanno precedente) diviso per 6.  inoltre, se il tuo conto presenta almeno uno dei seguenti dati: cittadinanza statunitense o residenza statunitenseluogo di nascita statunitenseindirizzo postale o indirizzo di residenza statunitense, incluse le caselle postalinumero di telefono statunitensebonifici ricorrenti verso un indirizzo o un conto statunitense saremo obbligati a considerarti un soggetto statunitense a meno che non tu fornisca i seguenti documenti: un modulo  w-8ben o un‚Äôautocertificazione di simile valore       e un passaporto non statunitense o un altro documento identificativo emesso da un altro governo, che riporti il possesso di una cittadinanza o nazionalit√† diversa da quella statunitensenel caso fossi nato negli usa, una copia del tuo certificate of loss of nationality of the us.

question: why does n26 do checks on transactions?
answer:
we have the responsibility to run routine checks on accounts and transactions in order to ensure your account‚Äôs security (see gwg ¬ß 10(new tab)). these checks are automatically initiated by our systems.  as a result, we may ask you to provide some documents. if you receive such a request, please send the requested documents via messages from n26. there are no exceptions or evasion for such checks.  this practice is a standard banking procedure and ensures the safety of our customers. both the process and the result are confidential and handled internally. here are some tips to speed up the process: the document that we need you to provide will be exactly named in the message you‚Äôll receive from n26. you can send us scanned documents, pictures, or screenshots, as long as the original content of the document is easily readable. please make sure to also provide a detailed description. be precise in your answers, details, and documents. after we receive your required proof and description, we will let you know if your reply fulfills our check. in a few cases, we might ask for further clarification which could prolong the process.reply as soon as possible, always before the deadline stated in the message you received from n26. use that email to reply and send attachments. our customer support doesn‚Äôt have any additional information on this subject.you must provide valid documentation depending on your situation. 
 find here some examples: you‚Äôve received financial help from your family to complete projects or have inherited land or money from deceased relatives.
a granting/loan contract, an official document of inheritance, or an official document of the source of the loan (such as the sales documents of a sold property to finance the loan or bank statements of granting relatives).you‚Äôve sold a property or your shares on the stock market.
the contract showing the agreed transactions or the official notarial documentation of the transfer of property.you‚Äôve received or sent money to pay bills or buy a product.
documents showing the balance statements confirming the source of this money or documents showing the use of the money and its purpose.you‚Äôve received a final payout from your previous employer.
documents proving the end of your employment, detailing the payment and/or a bank statement from your previous employer.

question: am i liable to tax in the united states?
answer:
as a licensed bank we‚Äôre required to report directly to the irs information about financial accounts held by u.s. taxpayers according to fatca, a legislation designed by the us department of treasury and the u.s. internal revenue service to encourage better tax compliance by preventing u.s. persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid u.s. taxation on their income and assets. you can find more information about fatca here(new tab).  in the context of fatca, a u.s. person is defined as, among other things: a citizen of the united states (including dual citizens)a resident in the united states, for example as a holder of a valid u.s. green card or as a person who passes the ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù (see below). if you‚Äôre unsure as to how to determine whether you‚Äôre a u.s. person, please consult a tax advisor. ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù means: that you‚Äôve been physically present in the u.s. 183 days or more in the current calendar year or that you have been physically present in the u.s. 183 days or more over the last three calendar years, to be calculated as follows: 
 
(31 days or more in the current calendar year) + (the number of days physically present in the u.s. last year) divided by 3 + (the number of days physically present in the u.s. the year before last) divided by 6.  in addition, if your account shows any of the following: u.s. citizenship or u.s. residenceu.s. place of birthu.s. mailing or residence address, including u.s. po boxesu.s. telephone numberstanding instructions to a u.s. address or an account maintained in the us we‚Äôre still obliged to treat you as a u.s. person, unless we receive the following from you:  a w-8ben or similar agreed self-certification form anda non-u.s. passport or other government-issued identification evidencing your citizenship or nationality in a country other than the u.s.in case you were born in the us, a copy of your certificate of loss of nationality of the us.

question: how to create and manage standing orders?
answer: when setting up an outgoing transfer in either the n26 app or web app you‚Äôll have the option to make it a standing order. once you complete the outgoing transfer you‚Äôll then be prompted to tick a box which will create a standing order. after you‚Äôve inputted the amount of the transfer and its recipient, under the reference text field select "want to save this as a standing order?". from here you‚Äôll be able to set the start/end dates of the standing order and choose its payment intervals. to view your scheduled transfers and standing orders directly in the mobile app: go to your transaction list (the main screen).then tap on the 3 dots located in the upper right corner for android and on the top of the transaction list for ios. a small window will pop, where you will be able to select "standing orders". here you can cancel and/or modify the details of your standing order. to cancel it just tap the standing order you wish to delete and tap the trash icon in the top right-hand corner. ‚ÑπÔ∏è  please note, if a standing order fails due to insufficient funds we won‚Äôt attempt the transfer again - you‚Äôll need to manually send the transfer, however the next scheduled transfers will proceed as normal.

question: how to use google pay?
answer: applies to germany, spain, italy, ireland, belgium, slovakia, france, denmark, finland, sweden, norway, poland and switzerland.  google pay is a payment method that allows you to pay with your smartphone so you don‚Äôt have to carry your mastercard with you all the time. google pay is available in all shops supporting contactless (nfc) payments as well as online shops. hold your smartphone near the contactless terminal and your payment will automatically process. when paying online, select google pay as the payment option. we‚Äôll ask you to confirm your payment via push message during checkout. some tips to keep in mind: to add your n26 mastercard, download the google pay app and select get started to enter your card details. you‚Äôll need android 5.0 (lollipop) or higher as well as an nfc-capable smartphone.google pay requires a screen lock. if you didn‚Äôt set it up yet, you‚Äôll be asked to before adding your mastercard to the google pay app.if you‚Äôre protecting your smartphone with a case, you might have to remove it to pay. some payment terminals don‚Äôt recognize your phone if the case is too big.if the payment terminal asks you to present your card (again), you might have removed the smartphone too fast or didn‚Äôt hold it close enough. just try again while keeping this in mind.

question: custom audiences
answer: datenverarbeitung im rahmen von facebook custom audiences custom audiences erm√∂glicht uns, dich als bestehenden n26 kunden von unseren werbema√ünahmen auszuschlie√üen. wir m√∂chten dir keine irrelevante werbung anzeigen. dar√ºber k√∂nnen wir eine relevante zielgruppe definieren, f√ºr welche die angezeigte werbung relevanter ist als f√ºr andere facebook-nutzer. diese sog. ‚Äúlookalike-audiences‚Äù sind unseren eigenen kunden √§hnlicher als der durchschnittliche facebook-nutzer.  um die oben beschrieben vorteile nutzen zu k√∂nnen, stellen wir facebook eine ‚Äúgehashte‚Äù version deiner n26 e-mail-adresse zur verf√ºgung. das sog. ‚Äúhashing‚Äù ist eine form der pseudonymisierung durch die deine email-adresse verschl√ºsselt wird, sodass du anhand dieser gehashten e-mail-adresse nicht mehr identifiziert werden kannst. deine gehashte e-mail-adresse wird von facebook dahingehend abgeglichen, ob diese auch bei facebook hinterlegt ist. nach dem abgleich, unabh√§ngig davon ob dieser erfolgreich war oder nicht, werden s√§mtliche gehashte e-mail-adressen innerhalb von 6-8 stunden gel√∂scht. facebook teilt diese daten nicht mit dritten oder anderen werbetreibenden oder gew√§hrt diesen zugang zu deinen daten. diese und weitere informationen kannst du den agb von facebook custom audiences(neuen tab) entnehmen. du kannst deine einwilligung zu dieser verarbeitung deiner daten gem√§√ü art. 6 abs. 1 bst. a dsgvo jederzeit in der n26 web app widerrufen.

question: shared spaces - trusted beneficiary
answer: a trusted beneficiary of a shared space can: transfer money from their own spaces (including other shared spaces of which they are a participant) to a shared space. access and freely transfer the funds of a shared space at any time.leave a shared space at any time. transfers between a trusted beneficiary and a shared space do not need to be authenticated via pin and push notification. this means that beneficiaries can seamlessly drag-and-drop money via the n26 app and web app similarity to how normal space transactions work. european banking law regulates how bank transfers must be authorised.  in this law strong customer authentication (sca) is a requirement to make online payments more secure.  one exception to this is the classification of a person in a shared space as a ‚Äútrusted beneficiary‚Äù so that transfers to this person do not require sca. learn more

question: custom audiences
answer: data processing in the framework of facebook custom audiences custom audiences allows us to exclude you, as an existing n26 customer, from our advertisements. we do not want to display irrelevant ads to you. furthermore, it allows us to define a relevant target group for which the displayed ads are more relevant than for other facebook users. these so called ‚Äúlookalike-audiences‚Äù are more similar to our customers than the average facebook user.  in order to profit from the benefits as described above we provide a hashed version of your n26 email address to facebook. the so-called ‚Äúhashing‚Äù is a form of pseudonymisation which encrypts your email address in a way that you can no longer be identified by this hashed email address. facebook then matches this email address against your potential facebook email address. after the matching, regardless of whether it was successful or not, any hashed email addresses are deleted within 6-8 hours by facebook. facebook does not share these data with third parties or other advertisers or grants access to these data. you can find this and further information in the terms of facebook custom audiences(new tab). you can revoke your consent according to art. 6 para. 1 lit. a gdpr to this data processing in the n26 web app at any time.

question: why was i charged more than expected?
answer: all transactions take place in real-time. we‚Äôll alert you when any incoming or outgoing transaction happens via push message. sometimes a transaction could look suspicious because the final debited amount can differ from the original transaction amount for a few reasons: a merchant blocks a higher amount for a deposit (for example, at a gas station, or a car rental or hotel booking), and the difference is credited to your account once the deposit is no longer required.changes in exchange rates may result in slight differences in the total for transactions made in foreign currencies. in both cases, we don‚Äôt charge interest for the difference in amounts. but if you‚Äôre certain that a transaction is unauthorized by you, we could help get your money back.

question: do i pay fees and taxes with n26 invest?
answer: n26 invest doesn‚Äôt charge any performance, transaction, or redemption fees. your n26 invest plan will incur a few other fees: monthly fee. charged on a quarterly basis and paid directly from the balance in your investment plan. depending on the size of your total deposits, you‚Äôll either be charged a fixed fee or a percentage fee:  average total amount of investment / n26 invest service fee (annually as a % of the total deposits; minimum fee of ‚Ç¨1,90)* ‚Ç¨0 to ‚Ç¨29,999  /  0.99% *‚Ç¨30,000 to ‚Ç¨49,999  /  0.79% *‚Ç¨50,000 and more  /  0.49% *  operating costs. paid directly out of the deposits in your investment plan. they depend on the investment strategy: fund strategy & their respective operating costs: invest 80: 0.44% p.a.invest 60: 0.40% p.a.invest 40: 0.36% p.a. taxes. investments in the capital market may result in capital gains or income from dividends on individual funds. income that is above the capital gains tax allowance is taxable in germany. investments are also subject to the solidarity surcharge and the church tax. you‚Äôre taxable in germany: we‚Äôll automatically deduct all applicable taxes from your total deposits so your potential returns always show the net amount after tax.you‚Äôre not taxable in germany: you‚Äôll receive the gross amount of your income. then it‚Äôs up to you to file your capital gains tax in the country where you pay tax. in either case, we‚Äôll automatically generate an annual tax certificate for you in february. you can find it directly in the app under savings & investment. you can also find exemption orders and loss certificates for your tax return there. find out more about the method for predicting n26 invest performance.(new tab)

question: how to block my n26 card?

question: why is n26 secure?
answer: to protect your account, we use a two-layer security architecture: secure login. your login, on both the mobile app and web app(new tab), consists of a username and password or fingerprint/face recognition (depending on your smartphone). please choose a secure password and do not reveal your login details to anyone.confirmation pin. this 4-digit code is required every time you make a transfer or connect/disconnect your phone. it is first set up when you have successfully connected your smartphone to your account, and can then be changed in the application after that. (note: a confirmation pin is not the same as a card pin, which is the code you use when you withdraw cash from an atm with your n26 card.) every time you contact us, we‚Äôll ask you some security questions to make sure it‚Äôs really you. but we‚Äôll never ask for your debit card number, card verification code (cvv), password, or your card or confirmation pin(s).

question: why was i charged an atm fee?
answer: atm fees could happen for a few reasons:  a ‚Ç¨2 fee applies to any additional withdrawal beyond our fair use policy. you can identify this fee in your transaction history as a separate transaction. we‚Äôll remind you via push message when you‚Äôre running low on free withdrawals. some atms may come with their own fees. this fee will appear within the same transaction in your transaction list, that is added on top of the withdrawal amount. we have no control over these fees and can‚Äôt reject or reverse them. you‚Äôll be informed before the end of a withdrawal if additional fees apply and will have the possibility of cancelling it.foreign currency atm withdrawals sometimes include fees. with the n26 account, there‚Äôs a fee of 1.7% of the withdrawal amount. this fee is waived for n26 you or n26 metal members. using your maestro for atm withdrawals. a ‚Ç¨2 fee applies to both domestic or international withdrawals. maestro is only available in germany, austria, or the netherlands.  good to know: to avoid certain fees, especially when travelling, you can use the(new tab) mastercard atm locator(new tab) to find free atms nearby by selecting no access fee.all atms that you can see in the atm finder support mastercard.you can find an overview of our plans and fees on our website(new tab).

question: why can‚Äôt i get a loan?
answer: (applies to germany and france) when applying for n26 credit, we ask about your personal and financial situation during our assessment. if n26 isn‚Äôt your main account, you‚Äôll need to securely log into your online bank account at another bank to continue with the application.for second bank accounts, we only accept banks from the country where you‚Äôre applying from (for example, french customers can only add a french bank account and german customers can only add a german bank account).we‚Äôll also look at your current schufa credit score. this search will appear on your schufa report but is only visible to you and won‚Äôt negatively impact your score. however, your score isn‚Äôt the only factor: we also require information about your monthly income, excluding any payments from public authorities (such as unemployment or child benefits).once you‚Äôve sent an application to us, you‚Äôre unable to change your answers for 90 days (even if your creditworthiness improves). you‚Äôll have to wait until then to apply for another loan.the decision is then calculated through an automated process. we cannot perform manual checks. if you‚Äôd like more information, here‚Äôs how you can get in touch with us.

question: perch√© ho un addebito doppio?
answer: nel momento in cui effettui pagamenti con carta avvengono due principali tipologie di transazioni: la pre-autorizzazione, che √® una transazione che prevede il blocco di un certo importo da parte di un venditore di prodotti o servizi per verificare la validit√† della carta o la presenza di fondi sul conto dei clienti. le pre-autorizzazioni sono molto frequenti per confermare prenotazioni alberghiere oppure il noleggio di auto.l‚Äôaddebito, che √® la transazione con la quale l‚Äôimporto viene effettivamente detratto dal conto.  nel momento in cui viene effettuata una pre-autorizzazione, questa pu√≤ diventare un addebito sul conto, pu√≤ essere respinta oppure scadere. nell‚Äôultimo caso, l‚Äôimporto ritorna automaticamente sul tuo conto entro i successivi 12 giorni. gli importi preautorizzati nel caso di noleggio auto possono richiedere fino a 30 giorni prima di essere nuovamente disponibili sul conto.  potrebbe essere di tuo interesse sapere che: talvolta sul conto appaiono sia l‚Äôautorizzazione che l‚Äôaddebito. questo accade, ad esempio, nel caso di pagamento offline, quindi non in tempo reale, oppure a causa di problemi tecnici al terminale di pagamento. anche in questi casi, l‚Äôautorizzazione scadr√† nei tempi indicati. nel caso non dovesse succedere, contattaci via chat e ti aiuteremo a recuperare i tuoi soldi. l‚Äôimporto della pre-autorizzazione pu√≤ essere diverso da quello dell‚Äôaddebito finale del conto per vari motivi.

question: why does n26 do checks on transactions?
answer:
we have the responsibility to run routine checks on accounts and transactions in order to ensure your account‚Äôs security (see gwg ¬ß 10(new tab)). these checks are automatically initiated by our systems.  as a result, we may ask you to provide some documents. if you receive such a request, please send the requested documents via messages from n26. there are no exceptions or evasion for such checks.  this practice is a standard banking procedure and ensures the safety of our customers. both the process and the result are confidential and handled internally. here are some tips to speed up the process: the document that we need you to provide will be exactly named in the message you‚Äôll receive from n26. you can send us scanned documents, pictures, or screenshots, as long as the original content of the document is easily readable. please make sure to also provide a detailed description. be precise in your answers, details, and documents. after we receive your required proof and description, we will let you know if your reply fulfills our check. in a few cases, we might ask for further clarification which could prolong the process.reply as soon as possible, always before the deadline stated in the message you received from n26. use that email to reply and send attachments. our customer support doesn‚Äôt have any additional information on this subject.you must provide valid documentation depending on your situation. 
 find here some examples: you‚Äôve received financial help from your family to complete projects or have inherited land or money from deceased relatives.
a granting/loan contract, an official document of inheritance, or an official document of the source of the loan (such as the sales documents of a sold property to finance the loan or bank statements of granting relatives).you‚Äôve sold a property or your shares on the stock market.
the contract showing the agreed transactions or the official notarial documentation of the transfer of property.you‚Äôve received or sent money to pay bills or buy a product.
documents showing the balance statements confirming the source of this money or documents showing the use of the money and its purpose.you‚Äôve received a final payout from your previous employer.
documents proving the end of your employment, detailing the payment and/or a bank statement from your previous employer.

question: how to download my personal data?
answer: the general data protection regulation (gdpr) is a european regulation on data protection and privacy that went into effect on may 25th, 2018. we‚Äôve added a data export option to the webapp(new tab) as a response to art. 20 gdpr. and, as with everything we do, getting your personal data you provided to us is transparent and simple, and you‚Äôre in complete control: go to üë§ my account then personal settings and your personal data. the right to data portability under art. 20 gdpr covers personal data you provided to us. art. 20 gdpr shall enable you to easily switch the service provider in case you want to use these data to open a bank account at another bank. this is why art. 20 gdpr requires to provide these data in a machine-readable format to you.  it‚Äôs important to keep in mind that the file is to be used for data portability purposes only and your computer might not be able to read a json file. also, if you can open the json file the data might be difficult to understand as it is not intended to be human-readable, but machine-readable. the file we provide has the only purpose of being transmitted to another bank.  as a mobile bank, we know the importance of data security. for this reason we take additional security measures before you can download your data, which are described below. we do so in order to make sure that you, the account holder, is in fact the person who downloads the data.   how to download your data you can request to download the personal data you provided for a current or previous account with us up to 6 months after account closure date. it will come in a machine-readable format so you can share it with a third party if you choose to. current customers: please request your data through our web form(new tab). you will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. this link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. and please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request. former customers: you can download personal data you provided up to 6 months after account closure date. to request this information, complete a data request form(new tab) and make sure that the information you provide correctly matches all your previous account information. you‚Äôll need to know: the first and last name, personal id number, and expiration date of the identification document (national id card or passport) you used to verify the account,the registered email address of the account,the date (month and year) you created and closed your account (check your verification email). for security reasons, we have to make sure it‚Äôs really you downloading the data: if any field is inaccurate or missing, your request will not be successful. you will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. this link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. and please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request. if you want more information about the collection, use, and processing of your personal data, please visit our updated privacy policy (deu(new tab)) (eu(new tab)).

(applies to germany and austria) with n26 savings, you can open a fixed savings account with a deposit between ‚Ç¨2.000 to ‚Ç¨100.000 for free. you can find it in the explore section then n26 financial products. you won‚Äôt be able to access the deposited amount until the plan matures (from 3 to 60 months) but you‚Äôll earn up to 1.38% p.a. in interest during that time. after that, you‚Äôll receive the payout directly into your n26 account. n26 savings is possible through the close cooperation of three companies(new tab) with different partner banks. you‚Äôll have to accept the t&cs of all four participating parties to open an account.

european law requires all member states to provide legal protection of up to ‚Ç¨100.000 per person per bank. we set an additional limit on savings accounts in countries outside the eurozone so that this protection doesn‚Äôt fall below this limit in the event of exchange rate fluctuations. want to tell your friends about us and earn some money? get ‚Ç¨15 for each friend that you successfully refer to n26. learn more about our refer a friend program.

question: how to make transfers in foreign currencies?
answer: we have partnered with transferwise to make foreign currency transfers easy. transferwise offers real-time exchange rates and no hidden fees. to initiate a transfer in a foreign currency start by logging into the mobile app:  from the home screen choose the actions tabselect send money followed by foreign currency transferselect the desired currency and enter the amount you would like to send in ‚Ç¨ (it will automatically convert into the foreign currency below). after that, you add a new recipient or select an existing payeefinalise the transfer with your confirmation pin you‚Äôll receive an email from transferwise to change your password and then you can use both log in details to perform the transfer from there. please note that in order for this process to work, you need to create a transferwise profile via the n26 app first, meaning that you need to try to go through the in-app foreign currency transfer flow. otherwise you won‚Äôt receive an email from transferwise to reset the password. please also note that foreign currency transfers in the app are not possible with the n26 business, business you or business metal account, nor are transfers to businesses. transferwise has its own transfer types and fees but this will all be indicated before you confirm the transfer. for detailed information about eligible recipients, please check transferwise‚Äôs available currencies(new tab). want to tell your friends about us and earn some money? get ‚Ç¨15 for each friend that you successfully refer to n26. learn more about our refer a friend program.

question: how to request the average annual balance
answer: the average annual balance is the mean balance of your bank account calculated over a timeframe of a year and based upon daily closing balances over that specific period of time.  you can request it even if you‚Äôve opened your n26 bank account less than a year ago.  the average balance is required in order to request your isee and receive social benefits. to request the average annual balance related to your n26 account, you‚Äôll need to: have opened an account with n26 within the reference yearhave your legal address in italy if you need to know the average balance for last year, contact us via chat through the n26 app. you will receive the calculation of your average balance via email in about 3 working days.
