question: how to dispute a transaction?
answer:
is there a card transaction on your n26 monthly statement that you did not make? did you place an order online, but never receive it? don‚Äôt worry, this article will help you figure out how to resolve these issues. a chargeback is a service offered by n26 through mastercard, which allows you to dispute transactions which you did not make, or where something went wrong with the merchant. for example, if you ordered goods online and did not receive them by the allotted delivery date, you may be eligible to file a chargeback and ask for your money back.  if you need to dispute a transaction, you can do it in your n26 app by navigating to the transaction you want to dispute, then clicking report a problem. if you already closed your account and you do not have access to the app, you will need to contact customer service via email to support@n26.com. note: if your dispute is due to an unauthorised transaction, you need to block and reorder your card to prevent further fraud occurring, before we can process your request.  
common card dispute faqs:  a: go to your n26 app, and reorder your card as ‚Äúlost‚Äù or ‚Äústolen‚Äù based on your circumstances. if your card was in your possession at all times, please re-confirm that you did not make the transaction yourself. if that is the case, you can go ahead and reorder as ‚Äústolen‚Äù. this will prevent further unauthorised transactions occurring, and secure your account. report the fraud with the police, and follow the instructions above to initiate a dispute.   a: if you did not receive a delivery date, mastercard chargeback guidelines allow for customers to file a dispute 30 days after the date of the transaction. if you received a delivery date, you can dispute the transaction from the date you expected to receive the goods. mastercard chargeback guidelines state that you must file the dispute within 120 days of either of these dates. a: first, try contacting the bank that owns the atm. this is the fastest way to get your money back. to help you out, here is some guidance on what you can say: dear xx,  i attempted to withdraw cash from an atm owned by your company, and i did not receive the cash, but was still charged. below, you can find information about the transaction:  amount: ‚Ç¨{insert amount}atm name: {insert atm/bank name} atmdate & time of transaction: dd/mm/yyyy at {insert time} (cet) atm location: {atm address - include the name of the street, shopping mall} please return the funds to my account, or i shall fill a chargeback with my bank.  if the bank which owns the atm is not helpful, you can follow the instructions above to initiate a dispute. be sure to include the transaction date, amount and merchant, and your reason for contesting this transaction, to allow us to have enough information. a: first, reach out to the merchant to see if they can help. this is the fastest way to get your money back. to help you out, here is a basic template you can use to raise this issue with the merchant:  dear xx,  i authorised a transaction to {merchant name}, but {merchant name} has subsequently charged me additionally, without my authorisation. below, you can find information about the transaction:  merchant name: {insert merchant name}  amount of original, authorised transaction: ‚Ç¨{insert amount} amount of non-authorised transaction: ‚Ç¨{insert amount} date & time of original, authorised transaction: dd/mm/yyyy at {insert time} (cet) date & time of non-authorised transaction: dd/mm/yyyy at {insert time} (cet) please return the funds to my account, or i shall fill a chargeback with my bank and a complaint to the police/authorities. if the merchant is unresponsive or uncooperative, you can follow the instructions above to initiate a dispute. be sure to include the transaction date, amount and merchant, and your reason for contesting this transaction, to allow us to have enough information.  a: your refund could take up to 15 calendar days from the date the merchant issued it. please be patient, and wait for this time frame to pass. if 15 days pass and you still see no refund in your account, you can follow the instructions at the top of this article to initiate a dispute. be sure to include the transaction date, amount, merchant and your reason for contesting this transaction to allow us to have enough information and identify the transaction.  a: at n26 we take every possible action to protect your account from fraud, including: the flexibility to choose when to block your card, activate and deactivate payments abroad, enable and disable online transactions and set up spending limits directly within your n26 appreceiving push notifications informing you of any activity occurring on your accountusing internal tools and card fraud prevention to detect and prevent frauddeveloping systems to reduce the risk of potential fraud occurring  a: there are 3 main types of card fraud: your card is skimmed & counterfeited, for example you used your card at a tampered atm which stole your card detailsyour card details are stolen online, for example:you ordered something from a fraudulent/fake websiteyour details were stolen from a legitimate purchase your online shopping account was hacked your physical is card stolen & used to make purchases a: below are a few ways you can protect your account from fraud: use trusted atms which are located within a bank branch order from trusted online retailers & websiteschange your passwords/pins regularly n26 will never ask for your card or account details outside the app or web app. don‚Äôt trust sms or emails that seem to come from n26 with odd links or which ask you to provide this information directly.change your card settings within your n26 app, for example: disabling online payments, atm withdrawals, payments abroad and setting spending limits based on your regular transactional behaviouravoid making magnetic stripe transactions if possible, as these are not as safe as chip based transactions or digital walletkeep your card in a safe place

question: shared spaces - was ist eine kontovollmacht?
answer:
shared spaces sind keine gemeinschaftskonten im klassischen sinn. sie funktionieren durch die erteilung einer kontovollmacht. die person, die die anderen teilnehmer dazu berechtigt, in dessen namen zu handeln, wird ‚Äúbesitzer‚Äù genannt. diese person ist und bleibt der alleinige kontoinhaber. der besitzer muss ein n26 premium-kunde sein, das hei√üt n26 you, n26 metal oder n26 business you nutzen. teilnehmer eines shared space sind nicht kontoinhaber des shared space. durch die erteilung der kontovollmacht erhalten alle teilnehmer das recht, im namen des besitzers √ºber die gelder innerhalb des shared spaces zu verf√ºgen. das bedeutet, dass diejenige person, die den shared space erstellt hat, dessen alleiniger inhaber ist. der besitzer eines shared space
 ist besitzer des gesamten guthabens auf dem shared space.kann √ºber die gelder des shared space jederzeit verf√ºgen.kann andere teilnehmer einladen, indem er ihnen eine kontovollmacht erteilt.kann die kontovollmacht eines teilnehmers jederzeit widerrufen.kann einen shared space schlie√üen, nachdem alle teilnehmer entfernt worden sind (in diesem fall werden alle gelder innerhalb des shared space dem hauptkonto des besitzers gutgeschrieben). 
die erteilung der kontovollmacht hat zur folge, dass der jeweilige teilnehmer vollen zugriff auf das gesamte guthaben des shared space hat. das bedeutet, dass auch die teilnehmer eines shared spaces √ºber alle dort verbuchten gelder frei verf√ºgen k√∂nnen. die n26 bank gmbh kann nicht haftbar gemacht werden f√ºr zahlungen, die von einer kontovollmacht gedeckt sind. erfahre mehr

question: why didn't an atm give me cash?
answer: it happens: you go to an atm doesn‚Äôt give you cash and, and in some cases, the amount is still deducted from your account. first, check your card limits in your card settings and make sure atm withdrawals are active.make sure that you personal limits are set higher than the amount you want to withdraw.please be aware that you can only withdraw as many funds as you have deposited on your account. otherwise, if you don‚Äôt have an overdraft, the withdrawal will be rejected.the fixed maximum daily (24 hours rolling) limit for withdrawals is 2500‚Ç¨. some atms have their own limits in place, so it can happen that you can‚Äôt withdraw your daily limit at once. if you didn‚Äôt receive cash from the atm, but the amount was still charged from your account, we‚Äôre happy to help you: the amount that was deducted from your balance is only an authorization, meaning that the amount is blocked or reserved to be debited by the merchant. when the merchant debits the amount, it‚Äôs called a settlement of the transaction. if your transaction was not successful the authorization normally expires within a matter of hours - or a maximum of 12 working days - and is then automatically credited to your account again. only in case the transaction has been settled we can charge back the amount from the merchant. you can see whether a transaction has been settled when it appears on your downloadable monthly statement (not only in your transaction list in the app). this means: if the amount appears on your monthly statement and/or hasn‚Äôt been credited back to your account after 12 working days, you can file a chargeback with us. in the meantime, we suggest you try another atm from a different operator. this rarely happens twice in a row.

question: how to get push messages?

question: what does n26 do with my tax information?
answer: the oecd requires certain tax information to be shared by means of the common reporting standard(new tab) (ecr). to carry out our obligations, we must establish which country you‚Äôre taxable in. we do this through your tax identification or national insurance number.  we forward this information via the german federal tax office to tax authorities in other countries if:  you live in a ecr participating country.you have a postbox or a second registered address in another ecr participating country.when registering you gave a telephone number belonging to another ecr participating country.you have a standing order, or make regular payments, to an account located in another ecr participating country. we also forward data to the u.s. internal revenue service(new tab) (irs) according to the foreign account tax compliance act(new tab) (fatca). we may request your social security number (ssn) in order to check your tax status in the u.s. because: you are a citizen of the u.s (including dual citizenship).when registering you gave a telephone number belonging to the u.s.you were born in the u.s. (or in a u.s. embassy located abroad).you‚Äôre married to a u.s. national.you gave us an address in the u.s.you make regular payment transfers to the u.s. to update your tax identification or social security number in the n26 app: go to  my account and tap on settings and account settingsselect personal settings then tax informationselect the country in which you‚Äôre tax-liableenter either your tax identification number or your social security number important information in germany, we need your steueridentifikationsnummer (11 digits) not your steuernummer (9 digits).if you‚Äôre not tax-liable in another country, contact us so we can confirm your tax status.in each and every case your personal data will be securely stored and only used for the fulfillment of ecr and fatca requirements.we‚Äôre unable to advise you on your tax status. if you‚Äôre unsure of your status please discuss the matter with a tax advisor.if you‚Äôve entered the country in which you are liable for tax but not your tax identification number, please remove the country from the list shown to you in the app, reenter the country, and enter your tax identification number again.

question: what's a garnishment and what can i do?
answer: a garnishment is a regulatory measure (normally effected by court) that seizes funds directly on your account as you owe them to a third party or to fiscal authorities so you cannot spend your funds in a different way.  we are legally obligated to seize your account as soon as we receive a garnishment and transfer order from the creditor. furthermore, we are obligated to transfer the garnishment amount to the creditor. we do this 4 weeks after receiving the garnishment or transfer order. until the whole amount is paid, your account remains seized. if we receive a garnishment we‚Äôll send you an in-app message to messages from n26 with the following information: datename of the creditor (and name of their legal attorney)reference numbergarnishment amount in case your account was seized due to a garnishment please read the in-app message we send to your messages from n26 carefully. in it we outline all 3 options you have: option 1: pay from your n26 account if you have enough funds on your n26 account you can transfer the garnishment amount with a transfer order(new tab). please be aware that the transfer order also needs to cover all interests and fees associated with the garnishment. otherwise your account remains seized despite the transfer order. please print out the form, fill it out, sign your transfer order and send it as a scan or photo to support@n26.com from your registered email address. please make sure that the size of the attachment doesn‚Äôt exceed 15mb. alternatively you can send it via post to: n26 bank gmbh claims klosterstr. 62  10179 berlin please note that it can take up to 2 working days to process a transfer order. option 2: pay from a different bank account you can decide to transfer the garnishment amount from a different account. before we can release your account we need a written confirmation from the creditor - either via fax to (030) 364285089 or via post to: n26 bank gmbh claims klosterstr. 62  10179 berlin please note:  we only accept information about the garnishment, if it‚Äôs forwarded to us from the creditor directly.if you arrange with the creditor to pay back the claim by instalments, they may forward us a so called ‚Äôruhendstellung‚Äô which is a temporary, conditional release of an account. we do not accept a ‚Äôruhendstellung‚Äô and there is no legal obligation to do so. option 3: convert your account into a p-account

question: wie lange dauert eine √ºberweisung mit transferwise?
answer: wenn du eine √ºberweisung mit transferwise machst, wird dir ein gesch√§tztes eingangsdatum angezeigt. stelle bei sicher, dass der name des empf√§ngers exakt mit dem namen auf seinem bankkonto √ºbereinstimmt. falls eine transferwise-√ºberweisung fehlschl√§gt, benachrichtigen wir dich mit einer push-mitteilung. der betrag wird einige tage sp√§ter automatisch auf dein konto zur√ºckgebucht. du kannst eine √ºberweisung nicht manuell abbrechen. aber wenn du den kundenservice von transferwise kontaktierst, k√∂nnen sie deine √ºberweisung f√ºr dich abbrechen. bitte beachte, dass die √ºberweisung nur solange abgebrochen werden kann, bis transferwise den betrag an den empf√§nger √ºberwiesen hat. sobald der betrag √ºberwiesen wurde, kann die √ºberweisung nicht mehr abgebrochen werden.  auch die empf√§ngerdaten k√∂nnen ge√§ndert werden, indem du dich mit transferwise in verbindung setzt. bitte beachte, dass die empf√§ngerdaten nur solange ge√§ndert werden k√∂nnen, bis transferwise den betrag an den empf√§nger √ºberwiesen hat. weder wir noch transferwise berechnen zus√§tzliche geb√ºhren f√ºr eine r√ºckzahlung. einige teilnehmende banken erheben jedoch geb√ºhren; in diesem fall zieht transferwise gem√§√ü seinen nutzungsbedingungen(neuen tab) diese betr√§ge von dem zur√ºckgezahlten geld ab. h√§ufige gr√ºnde f√ºr eine fehlgeschlagene √ºberweisung: fehler in den √ºberweisungsangaben (z. b. bei der eingabe des empf√§ngernamens oder der kontoinformationen).sonderzeichen oder zu viele zeichen im namen des empf√§ngers oder im feld f√ºr den zahlungszweck.limits wurden erreicht oder online-zahlungen sind in den karteneinstellungen nicht aktiv.√ºberweisungen in fremdw√§hrungen sind mit dem n26 business oder n26 business you konto nicht m√∂glich; zudem darf das empf√§ngerkonto kein gesch√§ftskonto sein.

question: crs - why we require certain information from our customers
answer:
n26 as a financial institution is (according to crs) required to report information directly to tax authorities in the european union concerning financial accounts held by customers who are tax resident in another country. crs stands for common reporting standard. the crs has been developed by the organization for economic cooperation and development (oecd) and is a global reporting standard for the automatic exchange of information (aeoi). the goal of crs is to allow tax authorities to obtain a clearer understanding of financial assets held abroad by their residents for tax purposes in order to fight tax evasion. more than 90 countries have agreed to share information on residents‚Äô assets and incomes in conformation with crs. in order for us to be able to accurately determine whether an account is to be reported to the tax authorities for crs purposes, we need to ask you: in which country(ies) are you a tax resident? 

you are normally a ‚Äútax resident‚Äù and therefore subject to tax on your worldwide income in the country where you have a residential address. if you have a place to live in more than one country, then there are normally ‚Äútie-breaker rules‚Äù included in double tax treaties and tax laws of the relevant countries that help determine where you are a tax resident. it may be that you are tax resident in more than one country during a year and, if so, we‚Äôd need to know both the country and your taxpayer identification number for each of them in order to accurately report the information to the relevant tax authorities. 
what is your taxpayer identification number (‚Äútin‚Äù) for each country?

the issuance and format of a tin differs by country. for eu countries, the european commission has published guidance on tins in each eu country(new tab), which may help you in identifying your individual tin(s) in these countries.  in case your circumstances change, you can always update your tax information in the n26 app. to do this, simply log in to the n26 app and go to: my account > settings > personal settings > tax information

question: how to log in with two factor authentication?
answer: two-factor authentication is an authentication process based on the use of two or more secure elements. you‚Äôre probably familiar with using only  your personal password to sign in to your account, but with two-factor authentication you‚Äôll need either confirmation from a paired device or an sms code. go here for more information on two-factor authentication when you log into your n26 account from the web app or a non-paired device, you‚Äôll be asked to confirm a push notification on your paired device or, if this isn‚Äôt possible, you can request an sms code to be sent to your registered number, confirming your login attempt. this ensures that only you can log in to your n26 account. when you log into your n26 account from your paired device, two-factor authentication is already in motion. this means the process of logging into your n26 account from your paired device stays the same. first, you‚Äôll need to update your phone‚Äôs operating system and the n26 app to their latest versions. if you‚Äôre unable to login to your account, but still have access to your registered email address, try to reset your password. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered email address, please contact us via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out. read more in our article on how to create a password. if you‚Äôve lost access to your paired device, but you still have access to your registered phone number, you‚Äôll be able to log into your n26 account and request an authentication code. to do this: login to the webappwhen prompted to confirm your login on your paired device, select helpchoose send sms codeonce you receive the sms code, input it into the webapp as you‚Äôve just confirmed the authentication code you‚Äôve successfully completed two-factor authentication, and can now pair your new device with your account. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered phone number ‚Äì either because you have a new phone number, or your phone was lost or stolen ‚Äì please contact our customer service via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out. if you have an older smartphone that doesn‚Äôt support the latest app version, you won‚Äôt be able to access n26 via the mobile app anymore using that phone.  however, you can still use our webapp to view your account, to do this you‚Äôll need to confirm your login attempt via an sms verification code which we‚Äôll send to your account‚Äôs registered phone number. you‚Äôll still be able to complete card transactions and cash withdrawals as normal using your mastercard, but bear in mind that you won‚Äôt be able to perform any bank transfers or payments until you can confirm the transfer within the n26 app. read more in our article on strong customer authentification.

question: what does n26 do with my tax information?
answer: the oecd requires certain tax information to be shared by means of the common reporting standard(new tab) (ecr). to carry out our obligations, we must establish which country you‚Äôre taxable in. we do this through your tax identification or national insurance number.  we forward this information via the german federal tax office to tax authorities in other countries if:  you live in a ecr participating country.you have a postbox or a second registered address in another ecr participating country.when registering you gave a telephone number belonging to another ecr participating country.you have a standing order, or make regular payments, to an account located in another ecr participating country. we also forward data to the u.s. internal revenue service(new tab) (irs) according to the foreign account tax compliance act(new tab) (fatca). we may request your social security number (ssn) in order to check your tax status in the u.s. because: you are a citizen of the u.s (including dual citizenship).when registering you gave a telephone number belonging to the u.s.you were born in the u.s. (or in a u.s. embassy located abroad).you‚Äôre married to a u.s. national.you gave us an address in the u.s.you make regular payment transfers to the u.s. to update your tax identification or social security number in the n26 app: go to  my account and tap on settings and account settingsselect personal settings then tax informationselect the country in which you‚Äôre tax-liableenter either your tax identification number or your social security number important information in germany, we need your steueridentifikationsnummer (11 digits) not your steuernummer (9 digits).if you‚Äôre not tax-liable in another country, contact us so we can confirm your tax status.in each and every case your personal data will be securely stored and only used for the fulfillment of ecr and fatca requirements.we‚Äôre unable to advise you on your tax status. if you‚Äôre unsure of your status please discuss the matter with a tax advisor.if you‚Äôve entered the country in which you are liable for tax but not your tax identification number, please remove the country from the list shown to you in the app, reenter the country, and enter your tax identification number again.

question: where is my refund?
answer:
in most cases, your refund will be visible in the app on the day of the original transaction, not the refund date. scroll down your transaction list or download your previous balance statements to find it. to view and download pdfs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements: on the webapp(new tab): from transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach downloads then select bank statements.
on the mobile app: if you‚Äôre using an iphone, tap on the three dots to the right of your current balance from the main screen. a menu will pop up and will give you the option to access your balance statement. for androids, you‚Äôll find the option under statistics (just tap the 3 dots in the top right-hand corner). the amounts blocked as a car rental deposit can take up to 30 days to return to your account while a refund of a card payment will be automatically credited to your account within a maximum of 12 days.

question: how to prove my identity?
answer: as a licensed bank, it‚Äôs important that we know who our customers are. that‚Äôs why we request our customers to prove their identity with a supported id document when they open an account or use certain products. we would never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. we‚Äôve gathered other tips to help you protect your identity. there are two different ways you can show us your id, and we‚Äôve also collected some troubleshooting tips for each: photo and video. the method you can choose to show us your id depends on your nationality, your country of residence, and the type of id you use: i live in germany(new tab)i live in spain(new tab)i live in italy(new tab)i live in a different country(new tab) if your id isn‚Äôt on the list, it means we cannot offer you an account with us at the time. we take identity verification very seriously and our customer support will not be able to make an exception for you regarding the supported documents. but we‚Äôre always adding new documents to this list so it‚Äôs worth checking back to see if yours has been added. in case your residential address is in germany and you‚Äôre unable to complete your photo or video verification due to a disability, please start the registration process by entering your details and then contact our customer support. we‚Äôre happy to assist you. chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including sundays and bank holidays.

question: how to download my personal data?
answer: the general data protection regulation (gdpr) is a european regulation on data protection and privacy that went into effect on may 25th, 2018. we‚Äôve added a data export option to the webapp(new tab) as a response to art. 20 gdpr. and, as with everything we do, getting your personal data you provided to us is transparent and simple, and you‚Äôre in complete control: go to üë§ my account then personal settings and your personal data. the right to data portability under art. 20 gdpr covers personal data you provided to us. art. 20 gdpr shall enable you to easily switch the service provider in case you want to use these data to open a bank account at another bank. this is why art. 20 gdpr requires to provide these data in a machine-readable format to you.  it‚Äôs important to keep in mind that the file is to be used for data portability purposes only and your computer might not be able to read a json file. also, if you can open the json file the data might be difficult to understand as it is not intended to be human-readable, but machine-readable. the file we provide has the only purpose of being transmitted to another bank.  as a mobile bank, we know the importance of data security. for this reason we take additional security measures before you can download your data, which are described below. we do so in order to make sure that you, the account holder, is in fact the person who downloads the data.   how to download your data you can request to download the personal data you provided for a current or previous account with us up to 6 months after account closure date. it will come in a machine-readable format so you can share it with a third party if you choose to. current customers: please request your data through our web form(new tab). you will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. this link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. and please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request. former customers: you can download personal data you provided up to 6 months after account closure date. to request this information, complete a data request form(new tab) and make sure that the information you provide correctly matches all your question: how long do transfers take?
answer: all domestic and international incoming sepa transfers are instant if they come from a bank that supports instant transfers and the sender selects this option. banking regulation applies to sepa instant transfers and may delay the transfer in case it needs additional monitoring e.g. when sending large amounts of money. in case the sending bank doesn‚Äôt offer instant transfers or the sender doesn‚Äôt choose this option, all sepa transfers should arrive within a maximum of 2 working days.  please note that outgoing sepa transfers are completed within one banking day. if the transfer is not instant, keep in mind that if a transfer has been made right before a weekend or bank holiday, the time frame will be extended. we send our sepa payment orders through target2(new tab). it‚Äôs open to process payments every working day from 07:00 to 18:00 cet. the system is closed on the following days: 1 january (new year‚Äôs day)good friday, easter monday1 may (labour day)25 december (christmas day)26 december. with moneybeam, you can transfer money to other n26 customers instantly and you can also receive instant moneybeam requests from banks that support instant transfers. times vary for foreign currency transfers with transferwise (but you‚Äôll see an estimated transfer time on the quote screen). you‚Äôll need to confirm each type of transfer via push message in the app before we send anything out. please note: we only accept transfers in eur via sepa (that means no swift transfers). if your incoming transfer is outside of these estimated time frames, please contact the sender (bank) for a payment investigation. we can‚Äôt investigate incoming transfers.

(for cards that cannot be easily destroyed by cutting, please store your card in a safe place.)

question: when will my card arrive?
answer: standard delivery takes up to 15 business days and is free of charge if it‚Äôs your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership. to stay up-to-date on the delivery progress simply go to the home screen of your n26 mobile app. express delivery takes up to 3 working days and comes with an additional fee of 20‚Ç¨. in addition to the banner on the home screen of your n26 mobile app, you will also receive an email with a tracking link to stay up-to-date on the progress of your card delivery. learn more in our dedicated article about express delivery. please wait until the estimated delivery time has elapsed before taking further action. your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership is always free. for the following ones, a replacement fee may apply. you need to verify your identity when opening an n26 account. please be sure you have completed this process by logging into your account. once this process is complete your account is activated and you can receive your n26 card. check your shipping details: üë§ my account > settings > personal settings > shipping address. it must be a residential address (businesses are not accepted).your name must be on the mailbox. if a different name is on the mailbox, please add it to the ‚Äôadditional info‚Äô in your mobile app.enter your postal code without any spaces.if applicable, add your building number, floor number and door code to the ‚Äôadditional address info‚Äô in your mobile app.if your address contains special characters then please contact our customer service from within the app.if you‚Äôre moving soon please consider the express delivery option and make sure to select the country and address where you‚Äôll move to. incase your details were incorrect, please update them directly in the mobile app. if it is your very first n26 card, please open a live chat from within the mobile or web app. if you had an activated card before, please reorder it directly in the app. 3. your first card after opening your account or upgrading to a premium membership is free of charge! you only need to reach a minimum account balance in order to trigger the production and delivery of your card. the one-time minimum balance depends on your account type: n26 standard account: minimum 10‚Ç¨n26 you account: minimum 9.90‚Ç¨n26 metal account: minimum 16.90‚Ç¨ as soon as your account balance reaches the minimum requirement your n26 card will be automatically produced and shipped. you will be notified in the app via messages from n26 and through a banner on the home screen that will show you the delivery progress. please note: the one time minimum balance is not a fee but a necessary requirement to trigger the production and delivery of your card.for premium account holders your first monthly fees are charged on the 15th day of your subscription and will be deducted from your account.for express delivery the fee of 20‚Ç¨ will be deducted from your account as soon as the card is shipped. please make sure that your account balance covers these fees in addition to the one-time minimum balance. use your card before it physically arrives: before the card arrives in the mail you can begin using it through your apple pay or google pay wallet. this way you can make purchases with your smartphone at merchants who support this payment method. you can learn more about how to use your card digitally. simply double check the estimated delivery date in the home screen of the n26 app or web app. if the estimated delivery date has been exceeded, please contact us via live chat from within the app or web app.

question: can n26 close my account?
answer: in short: yes. we can close your account in 3 ways (with 2 months notice, 14 days notice, or immediately). these cancellations are final: our customer support can‚Äôt provide any information about the background of individual cancellations nor can they reverse the decision. you‚Äôre also able to terminate your business relationship with us at any time, immediately, and without a reason. 2 months notice: we have the right to terminate any business relationship with 2 months notice without a cause (see section 19 (1) of our t&cs(new tab) or ¬ß 675h of the german civil code). 14 days notice: we can also terminate any business relationship with 14 days notice (see section 19 (3) of our t&cs(new tab)) if reasonable cause is given due to the breach of contractual duties. these include: using a personal account for business purposes. according to our t&cs, a private account may only be used for personal use. any credit transfers that relate to professional fees for provided services and/or sold products are considered business transactions. if you‚Äôd like to use your account for this purpose, please sign up for an n26 business, n26 business you or n26 business metal account.providing incorrect or insufficient information for a routine background check. we‚Äôre a bank so we sometimes run checks on transactions. if you don‚Äôt provide correct and/or sufficient information about the transaction in question, we have the right to terminate the business relationship in order to be compliant with german financial regulations.displaying abusive behaviour towards n26 employees. we don‚Äôt tolerate abusive behaviour towards our employees. the threat of physical harm or general abusive behaviour may be considered a criminal offense according to german law and will be reported to the respective authority without exception. immediate cancellation we may also terminate any business relationship on an extraordinary basis (see section 19 (3) of our t&cs(new tab)). that means: at any time, without prior notice, and without a cancellation period when there is reasonable cause for such termination. these include: providing incorrect statements to n26 about your financial situation, especially when you apply for a credit.failure to repay your loan or any debt toward n26.failure to comply with n26‚Äôs requests about your loan (see provision or increase of security, section 13 (2) of our t&c‚Äôs(new tab)).

question: why hasn't my referral bonus arrived?
answer: once your friend has completed all the eligibility criteria of our refer a friend program, we‚Äôll verify your reward. you can always sign in to your account in the app or webapp(new tab) to check your reward status. in most cases the referral bonus isn‚Äôt rewarded because the invited friend hasn‚Äôt made a first mastercard transaction of 15 eur. please make sure to inform your friend of these requirements. keep in mind that the reward process could take up to 60 days. n26 retains the right to withhold a reward in case of suspicious activity that violates the terms and conditions(new tab). currently, friend referral rewards are only available for customers in germany, austria, italy, france, spain, belgium, luxembourg, greece, portugal, ireland, the netherlands, finland, estonia, slovakia, slovenia, sweden, switzerland, norway, denmark, poland, iceland and liechtenstein.

question: how to connect or disconnect my smartphone to my account?
answer: in order to use your n26 account, you need a smartphone : either an iphone (5s or newer, at least ios 11) or an android (6.0 or newer - we do not support the customized versions of amazon fire and oxygen os). only one device can be paired per account. you‚Äôll need to pair and/or unpair your smartphone when you first create an account or if you get a new phone number or device. to pair your smartphone with your account, simply open the app on your smartphone. you will be asked to confirm your mobile phone number. enter the 4-digit code we send you via sms and your phone is paired.  if you want to pair a new device, you must unpair your old device for security reasons. you can do this in üë§ my account (mobile app) or in the web app(new tab) under üë§ my account then security settings if you don‚Äôt have access to your smartphone anymore. you‚Äôll receive an email from us with further instructions. if you log into your n26 account with a new device, you‚Äôll receive two codes ‚Äì a login sms code with 6 digits and pairing sms code with 4 digits. you‚Äôll need the login code to access your account and the pairing code for pairing your device.

question: how do i change my confirmation pin?
answer: you can change your confirmation pin at any time in the mobile application or webapp. in the mobile application:tap on the my account icon (‚Äú üë§‚Äù)tap on ‚Äúsettings‚Äù.select ‚Äùsecurity‚Äù. select ‚Äúchange confirmation pin‚Äù.enter the 10-digit token number on your visa debit card.create and confirm your new confirmation pin.in the webapp(new tab):click on ‚Äú üë§ my account‚Äù.click on ‚Äùsecurity settings‚Äù. select ‚Äúchange confirmation pin‚Äù.enter the 10-digit token number on your visa debit card.create and confirm your new confirmation pin. if you enter your confirmation pin incorrectly 6 times, you‚Äôll need to wait 24 hours before trying again. please note that, for security reasons, your pin cannot contain: parts of your date of birth or your addressrepeated numbers (such as 1111, 111, or 11), or sequences (such as 1234 or 4321).  if the pin you‚Äôve chosen is not accepted, please try again using a different one.  if your card was stolen or lost, contact customer support immediately by phone at 1-888-n26-0-n26 (1-888-626-0626) or chat through the mobile app or webapp(new tab).

question: how to keep track of my daily spending?

we automatically sort your transactions and display our findings in statistics (top-right corner of the mobile app) by sorting your: categories: we collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve our categorization (such as atm, food & groceries, or shopping). for example, if you send a moneybeam with the reference text lunch, we‚Äôll put it in the bars & restaurants category. if you feel like a category doesn‚Äôt fit, you can just change it by selecting the transaction and choosing a category from the drop-down list.

question: reinvest your n26 invest portfolio capital to moneyfarm (formerly vaamo)
answer:
you can reinvest the funds from your n26 invest plan to a brand new investment plan with moneyfarm.  
important risk notice: as this option would mean closing your existing portfolio and reinvesting the capital in a new portfolio, this can result in a financial loss depending on the actual market value of your portfolio compared to the amount originally invested. to begin the transfer of your portfolio capital to a new investment plan with moneyfarm please follow the steps below: register an account with(new tab) moneyfarm(new tab) (please use the link you received in the email we sent you as special conditions apply for n26 customers). you‚Äôll need to verify your email address with recommendation that suits your needs.  plan your investment by selecting a strategy/portfolio and choose your initial investment as well as your monthly investment plan. a minimum investment amount does not apply for existing n26 invest customers. open the account by entering relevant personal information (name, address, date of birth etc).you‚Äôll then need to confirm both moneyfarm and fil fondsbank‚Äôs (ffb) legal documentation.complete verification by either video verification or postident.once your application is accepted, you can reach out to moneyfarm (new tab)customer support(new tab)* who will arrange the transfer of your n26 invest portfolio and the reinvestment of your portfolio capital to your new moneyfarm investment plan.     their customer service will provide you with an already completed portfolio form that you‚Äôll need to sign and send back to moneyfarm (electronic signatures are accepted).  moneyfarm will then instruct ffb to complete the transfer of your n26 invest portfolio. please note that this option must be completed by 03.09.2019 ‚Äì  the completion of your sign-up, verification and transfer of your portfolio capital make take up to several days, please ensure that these steps are completed in their entirety before the above date. you‚Äôll be able to contact moneyfarm here:  tel: +49 (0) 69 3807 6632 email: service@moneyfarm.de(new tab) moneyfarm‚Äôs website is currently only available in german but their customer service will be able to answer any queries in english.

question: how do contactless payments work?
answer: it‚Äôs not possible to deactivate contactless payments. if you‚Äôre experiencing issues with your contactless payments, keep in mind that:   to activate contactless payments, you must first use your card at an atm or payment terminal. transactions up to ‚Ç¨50 don‚Äôt require a card pin*. for amounts over ‚Ç¨50, you‚Äôll need to enter your card pin.  *if the merchant‚Äôs payment system supports this option. make sure your card is held directly onto an nfc-compatible payment terminal. if you remove your card too fast or didn‚Äôt hold it close enough, just try again. n26 metal cards only have nfc on the back side of the card. make sure to hold the back side of the card against the terminal to use nfc (using the front won‚Äôt work). if contactless is not working, please always try to use the chip and pin method to complete your payment.

question: psd2 - secure open banking
answer:
payment services directive 2 (‚Äúpsd2‚Äù) is a revised european directive allowing you to access your account information and initiate payments through regulated third-party providers in a safe and secure manner. 
 
this means that you can permit regulated third party providers to access your account information through a dedicated interface:  you can enable an account information service (ais) to pull together data from different bank accounts you may have, and then aggregate and manage their details in the same place through certified third-party providers.you can securely pay at the checkout of any website that offers payment initiation services (pis).  the data exchange is handled in the background via our partner - token.io. if you begin using a third-party payment service like an account information service or a payment initiation service, you‚Äôll be redirected to your n26 app via token.io to confirm the access request. in our privacy policy(new tab) we inform you about the purposes, involved parties and legal bases of the necessary data processing involved to fulfil our obligations as part of the revised european payment services directive. faqs if a third party provider has not integrated with our dedicated interface, the third party provider will need to integrate with our dedicated interface via our partner token.io. you need to contact the respective third party provider and revoke the access permission directly with them.  *applies to all countries in the eea.

question: why did my transferwise account linking fail?
answer: we are sorry that you cannot currently link your existing transferwise account. the most common reason why this could have happened is due to incomplete personal details on your transferwise account.  if you have set up an account in the past directly with transferwise using the same email address as that registered on your n26 account, and you did not fill out all personal details, we will not be able to link your account within n26.  please log into your transferwise account at www.transferwise.com/login(new tab), or via their app, and ensure that your full name, address, date of birth and phone number are complete.  if you cannot remember your password, go to www.transferwise.com/login(new tab) and select ‚Äòforgot password‚Äô to reset your password and access your account. if you cannot remember creating an account with transferwise, you should still try to log in by resetting your password. it could be that it was created via another partner or some time ago.

question: how to prove my identity?
answer: as a licensed bank, it‚Äôs important that we know who our customers are. that‚Äôs why we request our customers to prove their identity with a supported id document when they open an account or use certain products. we would never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. we‚Äôve gathered other tips to help you protect your identity. there are two different ways you can show us your id, and we‚Äôve also collected some troubleshooting tips for each: photo and video. the method you can choose to show us your id depends on your nationality, your country of residence, and the type of id you use: i live in germany(new tab)i live in spain(new tab)i live in italy(new tab)i live in a different country(new tab) if your id isn‚Äôt on the list, it means we cannot offer you an account with us at the time. we take identity verification very seriously and our customer support will not be able to make an exception for you regarding the supported documents. but we‚Äôre always adding new documents to this list so it‚Äôs worth checking back to see if yours has been added. in case your residential address is in germany and you‚Äôre unable to complete your photo or video verification due to a disability, please start the registration process by entering your details and then contact our customer support. we‚Äôre happy to assist you. chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including sundays and bank holidays.

question: how to top up by card, apple pay, and google pay
answer:
you can now add money by using a debit or credit card as well as apple or google pay. this is the fastest and easiest way to fund your n26 account. 
  adding money with a debit or credit card open your n26 app and navigate to the actions tabjust tap ‚Äúadd money‚Äù and select ‚Äúcard transfer‚Äùchoose an amount and enter your name on card, card number, expiration date and cvc (we never store your card information)follow the steps to confirm the paymentthe money is available on your account instantly   adding money with a apple or google pay open your n26 app and navigate to the actions tabjust tap ‚Äúadd money‚Äù and select ‚Äúapple pay‚Äù or ‚Äúgoogle pay‚Äùchoose an amount follow the steps to confirm the paymentthe money is available on your account instantly
 accepted cards:  debit cards.credit cards (except america express).prepaid cards (only for customers with italian terms & conditions). to find out more about the difference between debit, credit and prepaid cards read this article(new tab).
 cost:
whilst this is the fastest and easiest way to instantly add funds in your n26 account, for us, processing these instant top-up transactions is more expensive than other account funding methods(new tab) we offer.
 for both methods, the first deposit is always free but extra deposits are charged a fee of 3% of the deposit amount. by charging a card or digital wallet, your money is not sent to n26 instantly, and the fee covers additional costs associated with funding accounts before the money is received so that it is instantly available for your use.

question: can n26 close my account?
answer: in short: yes. we can close your account in 3 ways (with 2 months notice, 14 days notice, or immediately). these cancellations are final: our customer support can‚Äôt provide any information about the background of individual cancellations nor can they reverse the decision. you‚Äôre also able to terminate your business relationship with us at any time, immediately, and without a reason. 2 months notice: we have the right to terminate any business relationship with 2 months notice without a cause (see section 19 (1) of our t&cs(new tab) or ¬ß 675h of the german civil code). 14 days notice: we can also terminate any business relationship with 14 days notice (see section 19 (3) of our t&cs(new tab)) if reasonable cause is given due to the breach of contractual duties. these include: using a personal account for business purposes. according to our t&cs, a private account may only be used for personal use. any credit transfers that relate to professional fees for provided services and/or sold products are considered business transactions. if you‚Äôd like to use your account for this purpose, please sign up for an n26 business, n26 business you or n26 business metal account.providing incorrect or insufficient information for a routine background check. we‚Äôre a bank so we sometimes run checks on transactions. if you don‚Äôt provide correct and/or sufficient information about the transaction in question, we have the right to terminate the business relationship in order to be compliant with german financial regulations.displaying abusive behaviour towards n26 employees. we don‚Äôt tolerate abusive behaviour towards our employees. the threat of physical harm or general abusive behaviour may be considered a criminal offense according to german law and will be reported to the respective authority without exception. immediate cancellation we may also terminate any business relationship on an extraordinary basis (see section 19 (3) of our t&cs(new tab)). that means: at any time, without prior notice, and without a cancellation period when there is reasonable cause for such termination. these include: providing incorrect statements to n26 about your financial situation, especially when you apply for a credit.failure to repay your loan or any debt toward n26.failure to comply with n26‚Äôs requests about your loan (see provision or increase of security, section 13 (2) of our t&c‚Äôs(new tab)).

question: how to download my personal data?
answer: the general data protection regulation (gdpr) is a european regulation on data protection and privacy that went into effect on may 25th, 2018. we‚Äôve added a data export option to the webapp(new tab) as a response to art. 20 gdpr. and, as with everything we do, getting your personal data you provided to us is transparent and simple, and you‚Äôre in complete control: go to üë§ my account then personal settings and your personal data. the right to data portability under art. 20 gdpr covers personal data you provided to us. art. 20 gdpr shall enable you to easily switch the service provider in case you want to use these data to open a bank account at another bank. this is why art. 20 gdpr requires to provide these data in a machine-readable format to you.  it‚Äôs important to keep in mind that the file is to be used for data portability purposes only and your computer might not be able to read a json file. also, if you can open the json file the data might be difficult to understand as it is not intended to be human-readable, but machine-readable. the file we provide has the only purpose of being transmitted to another bank.  as a mobile bank, we know the importance of data security. for this reason we take additional security measures before you can download your data, which are described below. we do so in order to make sure that you, the account holder, is in fact the person who downloads the data.   how to download your data you can request to download the personal data you provided for a current or previous account with us up to 6 months after account closure date. it will come in a machine-readable format so you can share it with a third party if you choose to. current customers: please request your data through our web form(new tab). you will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. this link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. and please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request. former customers: you can download personal data you provided up to 6 months after account closure date. to request this information, complete a data request form(new tab) and make sure that the information you provide correctly matches all your previous account information. you‚Äôll need to know: the first and last name, personal id number, and expiration date of the identification document (national id card or passport) you used to verify the account,the registered email address of the account,the date (month and year) you created and closed your account (check your verification email). for security reasons, we have to make sure it‚Äôs really you downloading the data: if any field is inaccurate or missing, your request will not be successful. you will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. this link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. and please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request. if you want more information about the collection, use, and processing of your personal data, please visit our updated privacy policy (deu(new tab)) (eu(new tab)).

question: crs - la raz√≥n por la que pedimos cierta informaci√≥n a nuestros clientes
answer: n26, al igual que toda instituci√≥n financiera, est√° obligado a remitir informaci√≥n a las administraciones tributarias sobre cualquier cuenta bancaria a nombre de los residentes fiscales en otro pa√≠s. la normativa crs (common reporting standard o est√°ndar com√∫n de reporte) es un sistema de intercambio autom√°tico de informaci√≥n tributaria entre los pa√≠ses adheridos, elaborado por la ocde (organizaci√≥n para la cooperaci√≥n y el desarrollo econ√≥micos). para determinar si tienes que declarar tu cuenta al irs, tenemos que hacerte algunas preguntas adicionales: tienes tu residencia fiscal en un pa√≠s extranjero y por lo tanto declaras impuestos en este pa√≠s, donde tienes tu residencia personal. si vives en m√°s de un pa√≠s, hay reglas para la determinaci√≥n de la residencia incluidas en los convenios fiscales y las leyes tributarias del pa√≠s relevante, que nos ayudar√°n a determinar tu residencia fiscal. puede que hayas tenido tu residencia fiscal en m√°s de un pa√≠s a lo largo de un a√±o, en ese caso, vamos a necesitar conocer tu n√∫mero de identificaci√≥n fiscal de cada uno de estos pa√≠ses para poder enviar tu informaci√≥n a las autoridades correspondientes.  la emisi√≥n y el formato del n√∫mero de identificaci√≥n fiscal (tin) depende cada pa√≠s. en los pa√≠ses de la uni√≥n europea, la comisi√≥n europea ha publicado una gu√≠a con los documentos de cada pa√≠s(pesta√±a nueva), lo que puede ayudarte a identificar cu√°l es el tuyo.  en caso de que tus circunstancias cambien, siempre puedes actualizar tu informaci√≥n fiscal en la app de n26. para esto, tras iniciar sesi√≥n ve a mi cuenta > configuraciones > configuraci√≥n personal > informaci√≥n de impuestos y actualiza tu informaci√≥n.

question: crs - perch√© richiediamo alcune informazioni da te?
answer: secondo il common reporting standard (crs),  n26, in quanto istituto finanziario, √® obbligato a fornire informazioni alle autorit√† fiscali dell‚Äôunione europea sui conti di utenti che hanno la residenza fiscale in altro paese. il crs √® stato implementato dall‚Äôocse e disciplina le modalit√† attraverso le quali deve avvenire la scambio automatico delle informazioni fiscali (aeoi). lo scopo del crs √® quello di permettere alle autorit√† fiscali di avere una chiara comprensione delle risorse finanziarie dei residenti depositate all‚Äôestero in modo da poter combattere l‚Äôevasione fiscale. oltre 90 paesi hanno aderito all‚Äôiniziativa di condividere informazioni sulle risorse finanziarie e sulle entrate dei residenti in conformit√† con il crs.  per determinare se un conto debba essere riportato alle autorit√† fiscali per adempiere alle finalit√† del crs, abbiamo bisogno delle seguenti informazioni:   residenza fiscale: di norma, si √® soggetti a tasse nel paese in cui si ha la residenza e le tasse vengono calcolate su tutte le entrate percepite. se hai la residenza in pi√π di un paese, normalmente esistono degli accordi bilaterali tra i paesi che aiutano a determinare in quale paese √® necessario pagare le tasse. pu√≤ succedere di essere soggetti a tasse in pi√π di un paese nell‚Äôarco dell‚Äôanno. in tal caso, √® necessario fornire tutte le informazioni rilevanti (residenze fiscali e relativo numero di identificazione fiscale) alle autorit√† fiscali.   numero di identificazione fiscale (tin)  l‚Äôemissione e il formato del numero di identificazione fiscale (tin) differisce a seconda del paese. la commissione europea offre indicazioni chiare sul tin da riportare.  nel caso si presentassero variazioni della tua situazione personale, potrai aggiornare le tue informazioni fiscali in qualunque momento tramite la app di n26. baster√† eseguire l‚Äôaccesso > il mio conto > impostazioni > impostazioni personali > informazioni fiscali.

question: how to activate my card?
answer:
once you receive your physical card, you‚Äôll need to activate it. you can do this in the app only after you connect your smartphone to your account. or you can activate it directly from the web app(new tab).  you‚Äôll need your 10-digit token number: it‚Äôs found below your name on the front of your card (or on the back if you have an n26 you, n26 metal, or maestro card).  to activate your card on the n26 app, from the home screen:go to the actions tab,select cards settings and swipe until you see the card you want to activate,tap activate.
to activate your card on the web app, just select activate card from the home screen. if you live in france, spain, ireland, greece, finland, or estonia you must make a first atm withdrawal to fully activate your card. if you have multiple cards (for example, you ordered your card more than once or your delivery was delayed), you can only activate your most recent card. all other cards will be disabled. you‚Äôll need to follow these activation steps every time you reorder a new card, like if your card is lost, stolen, broken, or you upgrade your account.    after you activate your card, the next step is choosing a card pin.

question: how long do transfers take?
answer: all domestic and international incoming sepa transfers are instant if they come from a bank that supports instant transfers and the sender selects this option. banking regulation applies to sepa instant transfers and may delay the transfer in case it needs additional monitoring e.g. when sending large amounts of money. in case the sending bank doesn‚Äôt offer instant transfers or the sender doesn‚Äôt choose this option, all sepa transfers should arrive within a maximum of 2 working days.  please note that outgoing sepa transfers are completed within one banking day. if the transfer is not instant, keep in mind that if a transfer has been made right before a weekend or bank holiday, the time frame will be extended. we send our sepa payment orders through target2(new tab). it‚Äôs open to process payments every working day from 07:00 to 18:00 cet. the system is closed on the following days: 1 january (new year‚Äôs day)good friday, easter monday1 may (labour day)25 december (christmas day)26 december. with moneybeam, you can transfer money to other n26 customers instantly and you can also receive instant moneybeam requests from banks that support instant transfers. times vary for foreign currency transfers with transferwise (but you‚Äôll see an estimated transfer time on the quote screen). you‚Äôll need to confirm each type of transfer via push message in the app before we send anything out. please note: we only accept transfers in eur via sepa (that means no swift transfers). if your incoming transfer is outside of these estimated time frames, please contact the sender (bank) for a payment investigation. we can‚Äôt investigate incoming transfers.

question: fatca - pourquoi avons-nous besoin de certaines informations de votre part ?
answer:
en tant qu‚Äô√©tablissement de cr√©dit, n26 est tenue de communiquer directement au d√©partement du tr√©sor des etats-unis et √† l‚Äôinternal revenue service (irs) des informations sur les comptes d√©tenus par les contribuables am√©ricains ou par des entit√©s √©trang√®res dans lesquelles les contribuables am√©ricains d√©tiennent une participation substantielle selon le fatca.  fatca signifie foreign account tax compliance act et est une l√©gislation con√ßue pour pr√©venir l‚Äô√©vasion fiscale. introduit par l‚Äôirs, l‚Äôobjectif du fatca est d‚Äôencourager une meilleure conformit√© fiscale en emp√™chant les personnes am√©ricaines d‚Äôutiliser des banques √©trang√®res et d‚Äôautres organisations financi√®res afin d‚Äô√©viter l‚Äôimposition am√©ricaine sur leurs revenus et leurs actifs. vous pouvez trouver plus d‚Äôinformations sur le fatca sur le site web de l‚Äôirs : www.irs.gov(nouvel onglet) en effet, contrairement √† la plupart des autres pays, le syst√®me fiscal am√©ricain pr√©l√®ve l‚Äôimp√¥t sur le revenu des personnes r√©sidentes sur le territoire national, mais √©galement des citoyens am√©ricains vivant √† l‚Äô√©tranger. √† l‚Äôinverse, dans une majorit√© de pays, seules les personnes r√©sidentes sur le territoire national sont soumis aux imp√¥ts du pays de r√©sidence. les expatri√©s en sont donc exempt√©s. dans le cadre du fatca, et pour que nous puissions d√©terminer avec pr√©cision si votre compte doit faire l‚Äôobjet d‚Äôune d√©claration aupr√®s du fisc am√©ricain, nous vous demanderons de nous communiquer les informations suivantes : si vous √™tes citoyen des √©tats-unis (binationaux compris) ou si vous √™tes titulaire d‚Äôune carte verte en cours de validit√©
si vous √™tes imposable aux √©tats-unis
√™tre ¬´assujetti √† l‚Äôimp√¥t¬ª aux √©tats-unis ne signifie pas n√©cessairement que vous payez l‚Äôimp√¥t sur le revenu des particuliers aux √©tats-unis. cela signifie que la loi fiscale am√©ricaine vous oblige √† produire une d√©claration de revenus et √† d√©clarer vos revenus (mondiaux) √† l‚Äôirs, m√™me si vous ne payez aucun imp√¥t am√©ricain.
votre num√©ro d‚Äôidentification fiscale am√©ricain(nouvel onglet) (si vous √™tes effectivement imposable aux √©tats-unis)
vous pouvez dans ce cas nous fournir votre num√©ro de s√©curit√© sociale am√©ricain (ssn en anglais) ou votre num√©ro individuel de contribuable am√©ricain (itin en anglais). de plus, si votre compte indique un lieu de naissance am√©ricain ou un num√©ro de t√©l√©phone am√©ricain ou si vous mettez en place un ordre de virement permanent aux √©tats-unis, la l√©gislation fatca nous oblige √† supposer que vous √™tes soumis au fatca, jusqu‚Äô√† ce que vous nous prouviez le contraire. si votre situation fiscale vient √† changer, vous pourrez √† tout moment modifier les informations concern√©es depuis votre application mobile. pour cela, allez dans la rubrique mon compte > param√®tres > param√®tres personnels > informations fiscales.

question: why was i charged twice?
answer: we offer you banking in real-time. this means you‚Äôre able to see the processes going on behind your account that you otherwise wouldn‚Äôt see. there are two main transaction types that take place during an in-store or online purchase: authorizations. a block or reserved amount made by a retailer or merchant. this includes anything from your morning cup of coffee to hotel or car rental bookings (including security deposits).presentments. the actual amount that is deducted from your account. again, that cup of coffee is finally cleared from your account or you can get your security deposit back once that hotel room or car is returned safe and sound. once an authorization has been confirmed, we can‚Äôt cancel or reverse it. at that point, a few things can happen to your authorization: it turns into a presentment, it‚Äôs rejected, or it expires (and automatically returns to your account after 12 days at the latest. car rental deposits may need up to 30 days to return to your account). keep in mind: sometimes you‚Äôll see both the authorization and the presentment if they become disconnected or due to technical issues at the payment terminal. eventually the authorization will expire. if it doesn‚Äôt, we can help get your money back.verification authorizations (usually very small amounts) are used to check whether your card is active. this money will return to your account.the amount of an authorization can differ from the final presentment for a variety of reasons.

question: can n26 close my account?
answer: in short: yes. we can close your account in 3 ways (with 2 months notice, 14 days notice, or immediately). these cancellations are final: our customer support can‚Äôt provide any information about the background of individual cancellations nor can they reverse the decision. you‚Äôre also able to terminate your business relationship with us at any time, immediately, and without a reason. 2 months notice: we have the right to terminate any business relationship with 2 months notice without a cause (see section 19 (1) of our t&cs(new tab) or ¬ß 675h of the german civil code). 14 days notice: we can also terminate any business relationship with 14 days notice (see section 19 (3) of our t&cs(new tab)) if reasonable cause is given due to the breach of contractual duties. these include: using a personal account for business purposes. according to our t&cs, a private account may only be used for personal use. any credit transfers that relate to professional fees for provided services and/or sold products are considered business transactions. if you‚Äôd like to use your account for this purpose, please sign up for an n26 business, n26 business you or n26 business metal account.providing incorrect or insufficient information for a routine background check. we‚Äôre a bank so we sometimes run checks on transactions. if you don‚Äôt provide correct and/or sufficient information about the transaction in question, we have the right to terminate the business relationship in order to be compliant with german financial regulations.displaying abusive behaviour towards n26 employees. we don‚Äôt tolerate abusive behaviour towards our employees. the threat of physical harm or general abusive behaviour may be considered a criminal offense according to german law and will be reported to the respective authority without exception. immediate cancellation we may also terminate any business relationship on an extraordinary basis (see section 19 (3) of our t&cs(new tab)). that means: at any time, without prior notice, and without a cancellation period when there is reasonable cause for such termination. these include: providing incorrect statements to n26 about your financial situation, especially when you apply for a credit.failure to repay your loan or any debt toward n26.failure to comply with n26‚Äôs requests about your loan (see provision or increase of security, section 13 (2) of our t&c‚Äôs(new tab)).

question: how can i keep track of my daily spending?
answer: to make it easier for you to stay on top of your daily spending, we automatically sort your transactions(new tab) and display our findings in our statistics feature.  we do this by sorting your: categories:we collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve the way we sort transactions into categories such as atm, food & groceries, or shopping. for example, if you send a transfer with the reference text lunch, we‚Äôll put it in the bars & restaurants category.hashtags(#):there are  default hashtags for:transaction times (#weekend)types of transactions (#books)locations of purchases (#newyork)you can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags:tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or to remove unwanted tags. you can access the statistics feature in the n26 mobile application by either: 1. tapping on the statistics icon on the home screen. or 2. tapping the bullet point icon in the top right-hand corner of the home screen, then tapping statistics. please note that we are constantly adding new features to our mobile application. if you do not see a feature that we describe here, please make sure you are using the latest version of our application by visiting the app store or google play.

question: why didn't an atm give me cash?
answer: it happens: you go to an atm doesn‚Äôt give you cash and, and in some cases, the amount is still deducted from your account. first, check your card limits in your card settings and make sure atm withdrawals are active.make sure that you personal limits are set higher than the amount you want to withdraw.please be aware that you can only withdraw as many funds as you have deposited on your account. otherwise, if you don‚Äôt have an overdraft, the withdrawal will be rejected.the fixed maximum daily (24 hours rolling) limit for withdrawals is 2500‚Ç¨. some atms have their own limits in place, so it can happen that you can‚Äôt withdraw your daily limit at once. if you didn‚Äôt receive cash from the atm, but the amount was still charged from your account, we‚Äôre happy to help you: the amount that was deducted from your balance is only an authorization, meaning that the amount is blocked or reserved to be debited by the merchant. when the merchant debits the amount, it‚Äôs called a settlement of the transaction. if your transaction was not successful the authorization normally expires within a matter of hours - or a maximum of 12 working days - and is then automatically credited to your account again. only in case the transaction has been settled we can charge back the amount from the merchant. you can see whether a transaction has been settled when it appears on your downloadable monthly statement (not only in your transaction list in the app). this means: if the amount appears on your monthly statement and/or hasn‚Äôt been credited back to your account after 12 working days, you can file a chargeback with us. in the meantime, we suggest you try another atm from a different operator. this rarely happens twice in a row.

question: wie funktioniert google pay?

question: why was i charged twice?
answer: we offer you banking in real-time. this means you‚Äôre able to see the processes going on behind your account that you otherwise wouldn‚Äôt see. there are two main transaction types that take place during an in-store or online purchase: authorizations. a block or reserved amount made by a retailer or merchant. this includes anything from your morning cup of coffee to hotel or car rental bookings (including security deposits).presentments. the actual amount that is deducted from your account. again, that cup of coffee is finally cleared from your account or you can get your security deposit back once that hotel room or car is returned safe and sound. once an authorization has been confirmed, we can‚Äôt cancel or reverse it. at that point, a few things can happen to your authorization: it turns into a presentment, it‚Äôs rejected, or it expires (and automatically returns to your account after 12 days at the latest. car rental deposits may need up to 30 days to return to your account). keep in mind: sometimes you‚Äôll see both the authorization and the presentment if they become disconnected or due to technical issues at the payment terminal. eventually the authorization will expire. if it doesn‚Äôt, we can help get your money back.verification authorizations (usually very small amounts) are used to check whether your card is active. this money will return to your account.the amount of an authorization can differ from the final presentment for a variety of reasons.

question: psd2 - strong customer authentication
answer: sca acts as an additional layer of security for all n26 customers by providing two-factor authentication (2fa). this is an authentication process based on the use of two or more secure elements. you‚Äôre probably familiar with using just your personal password to sign in to your account but with two-factor authentication you‚Äôll need either confirmation from a paired device or an sms code. when you log into your n26 account from the web app or a non-paired device, you‚Äôll be asked to confirm a push notification on your paired device or you can request an sms code to be sent to your registered number to confirm your login attempt. this ensures that only you can log into your n26 account.  when you log into your n26 account from your paired device, two-factor authentication is already in motion. therefore, the process of logging into your n26 account from your paired device stays the same. sca is being introduced as part of the revised european payments services directive (psd2) which applies to all european banks. the objective of psd2 is to enhance the security of the customers‚Äô data and account security. find out more about psd2 in our dedicated article about the psd2.  faqs first, try update your phone to the newest version. if you still cannot log into your account but still have access to your registered email address, please try to reset your password. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered email address, please contact us via our live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out.  if you lost access to your paired device but you still have access to your registered phone number, please log into your n26 account and request an authentication code. to do this: login to the webappwhen prompted to confirm your login on your paired device, select help choose send sms codeonce you receive the sms code, input it into the webapp as you confirm the authentication code you‚Äôve completed two-factor authentication and you‚Äôll be able to pair your new device with your account again. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered phone number - either because you have a new phone number or your phone was lost or stolen - please contact our customer service via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out.  if you have an older smartphone device that doesn‚Äôt support the latest app version,  you won‚Äôt be able to access n26 via the mobile app anymore using your phone.  you can still use our webapp to view your account, to do this you‚Äôll need to confirm your login attempt via an sms verification code which we‚Äôll send to your account‚Äôs registered phone number.  you‚Äôll still be able to complete card transactions and cash withdrawals as normal using your mastercard but bear in mind that you won‚Äôt be able to perform any bank transfers or payments until you can confirm the transfer within the n26 app.

question: pourquoi ai-je √©t√© d√©bit√© deux fois ?
answer: nous vous offrons un compte avec notification en temps r√©el. cela implique que vous voyez tout le processus qui se cache derri√®re vos transactions. ce que vous ne voyez peut-√™tre pas avec d‚Äôautres banques. un paiement en ligne ou en magasin physique s‚Äôeffectue en deux √©tapes : l‚Äôautorisation (ou empreinte bancaire). la somme est simplement bloqu√©e ou r√©serv√©e pour le marchand. c‚Äôest le cas pour tous vos achats, de votre caf√© √† la r√©servation de votre chambre d‚Äôh√¥tel en passant par la location d‚Äôune voiture. les cautions sont √©galement pr√©lev√©es par empreinte bancaire.le d√©bit. le montant est d√©duit de votre compte. cela veut dire que votre caf√© est bien d√©bit√© de votre solde et que votre caution pourra vous √™tre retourn√©e une fois la voiture de location rendue en bon √©tat. une fois l‚Äôautorisation confirm√©e, nous ne pouvons pas l‚Äôannuler ou l‚Äôinverser. √† ce moment, votre autorisation peut : √™tre d√©bit√©e, √™tre rejet√©e ou expirer. dans ce dernier cas, son montant sera automatiquement cr√©dit√© sur votre solde dans un d√©lai maximum de 12 jours ouvr√©s. dans le cas d‚Äôune r√©servation de voiture de location, ce d√©lai peut aller jusqu‚Äô√† 30 jours. notez que : vous pouvez voir √† la fois l‚Äôautorisation et le d√©bit sur votre relev√© en direct s‚Äôils sont dissoci√©s ou en raison d‚Äôun incident technique avec le terminal de paiement. dans ce cas, l‚Äôautorisation devrait expirer automatiquement dans le d√©lai annonc√©. si ce n‚Äôest pas le cas, nous vous invitons √† nous contacter par livechat pour vous aider √† r√©cup√©rer l‚Äôargent.afin de v√©rifier votre solvabilit√©, des marchands comme itunes ou google play store peuvent demander une autorisation (souvent autour d‚Äôun euro). son montant sera automatiquement recr√©dit√© sur votre solde.le montant du d√©bit effectif peut √™tre diff√©rent du montant de l‚Äôautorisation pour diff√©rentes raisons.
