question: how to close my account?
answer: we are sorry to see you go, but we appreciate the time you spent with us as a customer. you have convenient options to close your n26 account. if you have a de or es iban you can use the following methods to request account closure: option 1: click here(new tab) to be guided through our electronic account closure process: this option is the fastest way to close your account.you will need to login to authenticate yourself.you will be guided through the process to close your account. if you cannot log in or do not want to, please follow the steps for option 2. option 2: please contact us via live chat or via email to closure@n26.com(new tab) from your registered email address using our cancellation form(new tab) (the form will require the below information): a statement requesting the closure of your account on a specific date or asap.your name.your n26 iban.if you have a positive balance in your main account or your spaces, we also need an iban within sepa to transfer your remaining balance. if you have an it iban you can use the following method to request account closure: please send your request through live chat (click the start new support chat button below) or via email to closure@n26.com(new tab) from your registered email address using our cancellation form(new tab) (the form will require the below information): a statement requesting the closure of your account on a specific date or asap.your name.your n26 iban.if you have a positive balance in your main account or your spaces, we also need an iban within sepa to transfer your remaining balance. a few things to consider when closing your account: for a quick account closure: if you have a positive balance, please transfer your remaining balance yourself. if you have a negative balance, top up your account.destroy your cards by cutting them with scissors or a paper shredder. the chip, nfc antenna and the magnetic strip should all be cut into pieces and disposed of separately. (for cards that cannot be easily destroyed by cutting, please store your card in a safe place.)

question: why is my transfer still pending in the n26 app?
answer: you‚Äôll need your confirmation pin to finalize all transfers whether moneybeam, standing orders, or cash26. your transfer will remain pending until you either confirm or cancel it via push message in the app. your confirmation pin differs from your card pin but you can use the same number for both. you‚Äôll be asked to choose your confirmation pin after connecting your smartphone (whereas you select a card pin after activating your card). if you enter your confirmation pin incorrectly 6 times in a row, your pin will be blocked for security reasons. you can restore your pin by changing it in the app: go to üë§ my account then tap settings and security. then tap change confirmation pin (iphone) or reset confirmation pin (android).

question: when will my card arrive?
answer: standard delivery takes up to 15 business days and is free of charge if it‚Äôs your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership. to stay up-to-date on the delivery progress simply go to the home screen of your n26 mobile app. express delivery takes up to 3 working days and comes with an additional fee of 20‚Ç¨. in addition to the banner on the home screen of your n26 mobile app, you will also receive an email with a tracking link to stay up-to-date on the progress of your card delivery. learn more in our dedicated article about express delivery. please wait until the estimated delivery time has elapsed before taking further action. your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership is always free. for the following ones, a replacement fee may apply. you need to verify your identity when opening an n26 account. please be sure you have completed this process by logging into your account. once this process is complete your account is activated and you can receive your n26 card. check your shipping details: üë§ my account > settings > personal settings > shipping address. it must be a residential address (businesses are not accepted).your name must be on the mailbox. if a different name is on the mailbox, please add it to the ‚Äôadditional info‚Äô in your mobile app.enter your postal code without any spaces.if applicable, add your building number, floor number and door code to the ‚Äôadditional address info‚Äô in your mobile app.if your address contains special characters then please contact our customer service from within the app.if you‚Äôre moving soon please consider the express delivery option and make sure to select the country and address where you‚Äôll move to. incase your details were incorrect, please update them directly in the mobile app. if it is your very first n26 card, please open a live chat from within the mobile or web app. if you had an activated card before, please reorder it directly in the app. 3. your first card after opening your account or upgrading to a premium membership is free of charge! you only need to reach a minimum account balance in order to trigger the production and delivery of your card. the one-time minimum balance depends on your account type: n26 standard account: minimum 10‚Ç¨n26 you account: minimum 9.90‚Ç¨n26 metal account: minimum 16.90‚Ç¨ as soon as your account balance reaches the minimum requirement your n26 card will be automatically produced and shipped. you will be notified in the app via messages from n26 and through a banner on the home screen that will show you the delivery progress. please note: the one time minimum balance is not a fee but a necessary requirement to trigger the production and delivery of your card.for premium account holders your first monthly fees are charged on the 15th day of your subscription and will be deducted from your account.for express delivery the fee of 20‚Ç¨ will be deducted from your account as soon as the card is shipped. please make sure that your account balance covers these fees in addition to the one-time minimum balance. use your card before it physically arrives: before the card arrives in the mail you can begin using it through your apple pay or google pay wallet. this way you can make purchases with your smartphone at merchants who support this payment method. you can learn more about how to use your card digitally. simply double check the estimated delivery date in the home screen of the n26 app or web app. if the estimated delivery date has been exceeded, please contact us via live chat from within the app or web app.

question: how to use my card digitally?
answer: you can make purchases with your smartphone: simply add your n26 card to your apple pay or google pay wallet in order to make purchases at merchants who support this payment method. you can enable this feature before your card arrives in the mail to start using your n26 account straight away but also once you have received your card and activated it. to add your card to your wallet follow these steps: login to your n26 accountgo to ‚Äôactions‚Äôselect ‚Äôcard settings‚Äô and swipe to select the card you want to addselect ‚Äôadd to apple pay‚Äô or ‚Äôadd to google pay‚Äô good to know: whilst waiting for your card to arrive this feature is available for 30 days after your physical card is being produced. if you don‚Äôt activate your card within the timeframe then this feature will be suspended. once you activate your card you will be able to continue using it digitally again.this feature is not enabled if you reorder your card or upgrade to a premium membership without blocking your current card. in these cases your current card will continue working with ‚Äôapple pay‚Äô or ‚Äôgoogle pay‚Äô until you activate your new card. if you need your card details but aren‚Äôt carrying your card with you at the moment then don‚Äôt worry. n26 allows you to view your complete card details in the mobile app if you have an active card and paired device. to view your card follow these steps: login to the n26 mobile appgo to ‚Äôactions‚Äôfrom your card list swipe until you see the card you want to usetap ‚Äôcard details‚Äôconfirm with your fingerprint, face id or phone lock pin you will be able to view your complete card details for 1 minute. please note, you won‚Äôt be able to take screenshots whilst your card details are being displayed.

question: how to connect or disconnect my smartphone to my account?
answer: in order to use your n26 account, you need a smartphone : either an iphone (5s or newer, at least ios 11) or an android (6.0 or newer - we do not support the customized versions of amazon fire and oxygen os). only one device can be paired per account. you‚Äôll need to pair and/or unpair your smartphone when you first create an account or if you get a new phone number or device. to pair your smartphone with your account, simply open the app on your smartphone. you will be asked to confirm your mobile phone number. enter the 4-digit code we send you via sms and your phone is paired.  if you want to pair a new device, you must unpair your old device for security reasons. you can do this in üë§ my account (mobile app) or in the web app(new tab) under üë§ my account then security settings if you don‚Äôt have access to your smartphone anymore. you‚Äôll receive an email from us with further instructions. if you log into your n26 account with a new device, you‚Äôll receive two codes ‚Äì a login sms code with 6 digits and pairing sms code with 4 digits. you‚Äôll need the login code to access your account and the pairing code for pairing your device.

question: how to order my card with express delivery?
answer: express delivery is a good option if you need your card in a hurry or if postal deliveries have sometimes failed to reach you for whatever reason. you‚Äôll be given the option to select express delivery when choosing a delivery method for your first card or if you reorder a card. you‚Äôll then receive a tracking link by email. if you‚Äôre not home during the delivery and your mailbox can‚Äôt be accessed, the card will be left at a nearby access point (you can find it through the provided tracking link). the card only stays at the access point for a limited amount of time. after that, it‚Äôll be returned to us. we‚Äôll inform you by email if that happens. if you order via express delivery, keep in mind that: your new standard, n26 you or metal mastercard will be delivered within 2-3 working days. deliveries take place between 08:00 and 12:00. deliveries can be made by dhl express to all of our supported countries within europe. it‚Äôs currently not possible to make deliveries to other countries.it‚Äôs not possible to cancel or change an express delivery once it‚Äôs been selected as the delivery method.to close an account, you must pay for the express delivery of your card. if your card hasn‚Äôt arrived within 3-5 working days of placing your order, please check the tracking link for an update. you can also use the tracking link to inform dhl directly about the details of your delivery address or to redirect the shipment if you can‚Äôt be there at the time of delivery. n26 standard and n26 you cards have a fee of ‚Ç¨10 for standard shipping and ‚Ç¨30 for express shipping (which includes the ‚Ç¨10 card replacement fee).

question: why did my online purchase fail?
answer: some reasons why your online payment failed: if you are unable to confirm the push message within 5 minutes, simply restart the payment process on the merchant‚Äôs website.if you do not receive a push message, please make sure that your smartphone is connected and that push messages are enabled on your smartphone.ensure that online payments and payments abroad are enabled in your card settings.a stable internet connection is required.if you are using an ios device, make sure you turn off the do not disturb mode.if the amount on the merchant‚Äôs site is different from the one stated in the push message, this may be due to the conversion of a foreign currency into euros.make sure that you disable any adblockers running on your browser.your maestro card can‚Äôt be used for online purchases.

question: how to invite friends to join n26?
answer: you can start inviting friends as soon as you have access to your account, in the mobile app or n26 webapp.(new tab) to invite friends: on ios: log into the mobile app and tap on the explore tab next to the + button.tap on refer friends.tap on your referral code to copy it.select one of the options available for sharing. write a message to your friend or use the default then tap send. on android: log into the mobile app, then go to my account üë§ and select the gift icon.tap on your referral code to copy it.tap tell a friend.select one of the options available for sharing.write a message to your friend or use the default then tap send. find out how you can be rewarded for your referrals with our refer a friend program (available in select countries).

question: how to use moneybeam?
answer:
moneybeam allows you to send money to your smartphone‚Äôs contacts without knowing their bank account details. in order to send a moneybeam, log into the app: from the home screen choose the actions tab,
tap send money followed by the moneybeam option,
either select a contact from your phone‚Äôs contact list or add a recipient manually, using their phone number or email address. for this to work, the recipient has to be visible as an n26 customer,
enter the amount and a reference text,

question: how long does it take to send money with transferwise?
answer: once you‚Äôve initiated your transfer via transferwise you‚Äôll be given an estimated time frame. when making a transfer, ensure that the recipients name exactly matches the name on their bank account!  if a transferwise transfer fails, we‚Äôll notify you via push message. the amount will automatically be returned to your account a few days later. you can‚Äôt personally cancel a transfer, but if you get in touch with transferwise support this way they can cancel the transfer for you. keep in mind that the transfer can only be cancelled up until the point transferwise pays out your funds. once the money has been sent to the recipient, it‚Äôs not possible to cancel the transfer anymore. the recipients details can only be changed up until the point that transferwise has paid out your money. after your money has been paid out, the recipients details can no longer be changed. you can get in touch with transferwise this way. transferwise doesn‚Äôt charge extra fees for a returned payment and neither do we. however, some participating banks do charge fees, in which case transferwise will deduct this amount from the money returned under their conditions of use(new tab). common reasons for a failed transfer: error in the transfer details (for example, when entering the recipient‚Äôs name or account information).special characters or too many characters in the recipient‚Äôs name or reference field.limits have been reached or online payments aren‚Äôt active in card settings.foreign currency transfers aren‚Äôt possible with n26 business or n26 business you or if the recipient is a business account.

question: why can‚Äôt i see other n26 users on moneybeam?
answer: to carry out real-time transactions such as moneybeams, n26 checks your smartphone‚Äôs contact list and finds other n26 users based on saved phone numbers or emails. you can also enter someone‚Äôs contact details manually to send them a moneybeam. if you don‚Äôt see your friend‚Äôs name on moneybeam but you know they‚Äôre an n26 user, they most likely haven‚Äôt made themselves visible. indeed you can manage your visibility as an n26 user. most moneybeam transfers that fail between n26 users happen because there are multiple phone numbers or emails listed in the contact entry of a phone‚Äôs address book. to avoid this, make sure you have the email and phone number your friend uses in your phone book in order to send them moneybeams. if the contact details you have stored don‚Äôt match, you cannot send a moneybeam to your friend. want to tell your friends about us and earn some money? get ‚Ç¨15 for each friend that you successfully refer to n26. learn more about our refer a friend program.

question: what steps should i take if i notice a fraudulent transaction on my account?
answer: if you don‚Äôt recognize a transaction or you‚Äôre sure you didn‚Äôt authorize it, blocking your debit card won‚Äôt be enough. in these cases you should immediately: order a new debit card and mark your current one as stolen. destroy your existing debit card by cutting it with scissors or a shredder. the chip, nfc antenna, and the magnetic strip should all be cut into pieces and disposed of separately.either call us at 1-888-n26-0-n26 (1-888-626-0626) or chat with us through the n26 app.  we‚Äôll help you from there and we‚Äôll do our best to get your money back. you can continue using your account for ach payments until your new debit card arrives.  you should keep in mind that changes in the final amount debited from your account don‚Äôt necessarily indicate fraud. please note that in cases of fraud you have up to 60 days to open a dispute with us.

question: how can i invite friends to join n26?
answer: you can start inviting friends from the n26 mobile application and web application as soon as you have access to your account. once your friend successfully opens their n26 account and spends $10, you will get $10 from us and your friend will get $5! to invite friends: on ios and android log into your account and tap on the ‚Äúexplore‚Äù button.tap on ‚Äúrefer friends‚Äù.tap on ‚Äútell a friend‚Äù. select one of the options available for sharing.write a message to your friend or use the default message then tap ‚Äúsend‚Äù. on the web application log into your account, then go to ‚Äúmy account‚Äù in the top right-hand corner of the screen. click on the ‚Äúinvite your friends‚Äù option (next to the gift box icon).after reading the instructions and viewing the terms and conditions, click on ‚Äústart inviting‚Äù.you can copy your unique referral code by clicking on it or you can send the referral directly via your preferred sharing method. related topics: ‚Äúdoes the link that i sent my friend expire?‚Äù the link does not expire and can be used at any time, unless your friend has already started the sign-up process. please note that we reserve the right to cancel this promotion at any time. ‚Äúcan i invite more than one person?‚Äù you can share your unique and personal referral code with more than one friend. you can even post it on social media! ‚Äúhow can i check the status of a referral?‚Äù you can check on the status of a referral directly through the n26 mobile or web application. to check on the status of a referral: in the mobile application:log into your account.tap on ‚Äúexplore‚Äù. tap on ‚Äúrefer friends‚Äù.tap on ‚Äúsee your invites‚Äù.any friends who have used your referral code will be displayed. in the web application:log into your account.click on ‚Äúmy account‚Äù in the upper right-hand corner.click on ‚Äúinvite your friends‚Äù.any friends who have used your referral code will be displayed.  ‚Äúcan i invite someone outside of the us?‚Äù no - n26 accounts are available only to us residents. ‚Äúhow does the referral bonus work?‚Äù when your friend has completed the sign-up process and made a purchase that is equal to or more than $10 with their n26 visa debit card, both parties will receive the bonus ($10 for the person who made the referral and $5 for their friend). in order to qualify for a bonus, the purchase must be a single transaction that is at least $10, not a series of transactions that add up to $10 ‚Äúhow long does it take for my friend and i to receive the referral bonus?‚Äù the referral credit should be added to your accounts immediately once the conditions mentioned above are met.

question: shared spaces - what is a power of attorney?
answer: the legal model behind shared spaces is called power of attorney (kontovollmacht in german).  participants of a shared space do not have equal ownership of the account like a joint account in the traditional banking sense. after receiving power of attorney the participants obtain the right to act on behalf of the owner regarding any transfer of funds within the shared space. the person authorizing the other to act on his behalf is called the ‚Äúowner‚Äù, this person is the only account holder. the owner must be a n26 premium account holder e.g. n26 you, n26 metal and n26 business you. this means that whoever created the shared space is its legal owner. the owner of a shared space:  owns all the funds within a shared space. can transfer funds freely in and out of the account anytime. can invite people to the shared space by granting others power of attorney.can revoke the power of attorney of a participant at any time.can also close a shared space after removing a participant. (all funds in the shared space will be transferred to the owner‚Äôs main account) by granting a person power of attorney, they‚Äôll have full access to all the money held within a shared space. this means that each participant can also transfer funds freely in and out of the shared space.   n26 bank gmbh cannot be held liable for payments covered by the power of attorney. learn more

question: how to manage my visibility as an n26 user?
answer: to grant you access to all our in-app features, n26 matches your contact data with other n26 users. in order to manage your consent to be seen as a n26 user, you can simply go to üë§ my account in the app and selecting settings then personal settings and personal information. then just check or uncheck the box ‚Äúi agree to be identifiable for other users as n26 customer‚Äù. all of your contacts who have an n26 account set to visible will show up in the in-app contact list. similarly, you‚Äôll also appear in the list of other n26 customers who have your contact information. your contact list is not permanently stored by n26 and is only used when accessing the respective n26 feature. you can access to all our in-app features, e.g. moneybeam, which carries out real-time transactions without typing in a 22-digit iban, but only by selecting a name from your contact list. vice versa, you can also request money from people in your contact list who then only have to accept (or decline) your request. also, being visible enables you to use shared spaces, a sub-account, which you can share with other n26 users selected from your contact list.

question: update on n26 invest (general information)
answer:
*update effective 17.07.19 we‚Äôve decided to end our partnership with moneyfarm (formerly vaamo), the company that provides our n26 invest product. from 17.09.2019, n26 invest will no longer be available in the n26 app. we made this decision as we feel the product no longer serves the needs of the majority of our current customers. 
we‚Äôve sent you ‚Äì n26 invest customers ‚Äì an email update. this article contains detailed information on the three different options available to you:  1. close and liquidate (cash out) your n26 invest portfolio  until 16.09.2019 you can liquidate and cash out your n26 invest portfolio via the n26 app. full instructions on this option can be found by clicking this link.  2. reinvest your n26 invest portfolio capital to moneyfarm (formerly vaamo)  you can sign-up with moneyfarm and reinvest your n26 invest portfolio with moneyfarm. note: in may april 2019 european digital wealth manager moneyfarm (an online investment company) acquired vaamo. further information on moneyfarm can be found here(new tab). if you choose this option you‚Äôll have your n26 invest plan closed, and the portfolio capital reinvested into a new moneyfarm investment plan. step by step instructions can be found by clicking this link.   3. continue with your existing portfolio via fil fondsbank gmbh (ffb)     ffb is the bank that holds your invest depot. if by 17.09.19 you‚Äôve not chosen option 1 or 2 as described above, ffb will contact you by post providing you with a letter that will contain your login data that can be used to access your existing investment portfolio via the ffb website. note: if you have changed your address since you‚Äôve opened your invest account, please inform ffb so that they send the documents to the correct address.

accessing your investment portfolio through ffb‚Äôs website will be possible as soon as you receive your login data from ffb. full information about this option can be found by clicking this link. whilst we‚Äôre ending our partnership with moneyfarm (formerly vaamo) and ending our business relationship with you in regards to the n26 invest product, this will have no bearing on any other aspect of your n26 account or any premium membership plans that you may have with us.   faqs since launching n26 invest in 2016, we‚Äôve gone on to develop more products & services that reflect our growing customer base and the increasingly global nature of our bank. we are committed to bringing you new products that will make your financial lives easier and tailored for your needs in the future.  the good news is you can continue your investment portfolio with fil fondsbank. the email you received from us summarises the information, and you can see further details in our support center. alternatively if you take no action, fil fondsbank gmbh (ffb) will contact you by letter before 17.09.2019 providing you with login data to use so you can access your existing portfolio via the ffb website as soon as you receive your login data to the ffb website from ffb.  in april this year, european digital wealth manager moneyfarm acquired vaamo. further information about moneyfarm can be found on their website(new tab).  section 11.3. of our terms and conditions for n26 invest details the right of termination from our side. sorry if this has come as disappointing news to you. don‚Äôt forget you still have the option to reinvest your n26 invest portfolio with moneyfarm (formerly vaamo) as explained in our email and dedicated article on the subject. you also have the option to continue your current n26 invest plan via fil fondsbank gmbh.  not at all. closure of your n26 invest portfolio will not affect your n26 account, premium membership or other products you may hold with us.  any capital gains tax you would be required to pay will be withheld automatically by ffb  unless you have provided an exemption order for capital gains (freistellungsauftrag). any remaining cash would then be transferred to the reference account (your n26 bank account).    in order to settle tax debts you must explicitly instruct ffb to sell units within the investment funds. if you close n26 invest via the n26 app all investment funds will be sold automatically and any capital gains tax withheld by ffb.  after closing an n26 invest portfolio, fil fondsbank gmbh (ffb) will send you tax reports by post if there was a tax exemption in place. in the event that you move after closure of your n26 invest portfolio, please contact ffb to inform them of your new address.   contact details for ffb: 
monday to friday from 8am to 6pm telephone: +49 (0) 69 770 60 - 200 fax: +49 (0) 69 770 60 - 555

question: fatca - why we require certain information from our customers
answer:
as a financial institution, n26 is required to report information about financial accounts held by u.s. taxpayers or by foreign entities (in which u.s. taxpayers hold a substantial ownership interest according to fatca) to the united states department of treasury and the internal revenue service (‚Äúirs‚Äù). fatca is an acronym for foreign account tax compliance act and is a legislation designed to prevent tax evasion. another purpose of fatca is to encourage better tax compliance by preventing u.s. persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid u.s. taxation on their income and assets. you can find more information about fatca on the irs website(new tab). the u.s. tax system includes u.s. citizens who are not presently residing in the u.s. in comparison. so in order for us to be able to accurately determine whether your account is to be reported to the irs, we‚Äôll need to ask you: are you (also) a citizen or green card holder of the united states? 
are you subject to tax in the u.s?

being ‚Äúsubject to tax‚Äù in the u.s. does not necessarily mean that you‚Äôre also paying personal income tax in the u.s. it means that u.s. tax law requires you to file a tax return and declare your (worldwide) income to the irs, even if you don‚Äôt end up paying any u.s. tax.
if so, what is your u.s. taxpayer identification number?

as a u.s. tin you can either use your u.s. social security number (‚Äússn‚Äù) or your u.s. individual taxpayer identification number (itin). you can find more information about tin on the irs‚Äô website(new tab). additionally, if your account shows: a u.s. place of birth, a u.s. telephone number,a standing order to the u.s. then we are required by fatca legislation to initially assume that you are subject to fatca until you can specifically confirm to us otherwise. in case your circumstances change, you can always update your tax information in the n26 app. to do this, simply log in to the n26 app and go to: my account > settings > personal settings > tax information

question: how to log in with two factor authentication?
answer: two-factor authentication is an authentication process based on the use of two or more secure elements. you‚Äôre probably familiar with using only  your personal password to sign in to your account, but with two-factor authentication you‚Äôll need either confirmation from a paired device or an sms code. go here for more information on two-factor authentication when you log into your n26 account from the web app or a non-paired device, you‚Äôll be asked to confirm a push notification on your paired device or, if this isn‚Äôt possible, you can request an sms code to be sent to your registered number, confirming your login attempt. this ensures that only you can log in to your n26 account. when you log into your n26 account from your paired device, two-factor authentication is already in motion. this means the process of logging into your n26 account from your paired device stays the same. first, you‚Äôll need to update your phone‚Äôs operating system and the n26 app to their latest versions. if you‚Äôre unable to login to your account, but still have access to your registered email address, try to reset your password. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered email address, please contact us via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out. read more in our article on how to create a password. if you‚Äôve lost access to your paired device, but you still have access to your registered phone number, you‚Äôll be able to log into your n26 account and request an authentication code. to do this: login to the webappwhen prompted to confirm your login on your paired device, select helpchoose send sms codeonce you receive the sms code, input it into the webapp as you‚Äôve just confirmed the authentication code you‚Äôve successfully completed two-factor authentication, and can now pair your new device with your account. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered phone number ‚Äì either because you have a new phone number, or your phone was lost or stolen ‚Äì please contact our customer service via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out. if you have an older smartphone that doesn‚Äôt support the latest app version, you won‚Äôt be able to access n26 via the mobile app anymore using that phone.  however, you can still use our webapp to view your account, to do this you‚Äôll need to confirm your login attempt via an sms verification code which we‚Äôll send to your account‚Äôs registered phone number. you‚Äôll still be able to complete card transactions and cash withdrawals as normal using your mastercard, but bear in mind that you won‚Äôt be able to perform any bank transfers or payments until you can confirm the transfer within the n26 app. read more in our article on strong customer authentification.

question: how to protect my identity?
answer: to protect and help avoid the misuse of your personal data, please keep in mind that: we will never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. this includes verifications for apartment rental contracts, lines of credit, or job offers (including jobs with n26). only complete the verification process if you want to open an n26 bank account for yourself.as the account owner, only you should create and have access to your login details. never create an n26 bank account with a predefined email address and password. if you use login credentials that were given to you, these credentials may be used to reach your personal and legal information. also, never log into an n26 account that is not yours.do not send your id or passport to unknown or unverified recipients.we may ask for certain documents when your transaction is subject to a routine check. only send valid documentation to verified n26 email accounts.we will never ask for your username, password, or pin codes outside the n26 app. never provide this information in an external website or app, even if it looks n26-related. if you ever feel in doubt, have received a suspicious request from a third party, or think your n26 login may be compromised, please do not hesitate to contact us.

online banking with the external bank. unfortunately, you cannot cancel pending transfers.  you can cancel a transfer at any time before you confirm the transaction. once the transfer is confirmed, you can no longer cancel it. no, you may only use this feature to transfer funds into your n26 account, not to transfer funds out of your n26 account. my external account is owned by me, but i am still unable to link it to my n26 account. even though you own the external account, your attempt to link may have failed because the external account needs to be a us bank account and needs to be in your name (i.e. the same name you used to open your n26 account). unfortunately, you will not be able to see pending transfers. it takes approximately 5 business days for a transfer to settle and for the transferred funds to be available in your n26 account. once the transfer is successful, you will see it in your n26 transaction feed. you will also receive push notifications for successful or unsuccessful transfers. this means the funds did not successfully transfer.  you should check your email for the failure reason and reattempt the transfer.  you do not have to link to your external bank account more than once.  you may, however, need to re-enter your external account credentials occasionally due to either a change in those credentials or for security reasons. how to link your external bank account to your n26 account via the n26 mobile application. launch your n26 mobile application.tap the "actions" button at the bottom right of your mobile‚Äôs screen.tap on "add money".tap "external bank transfer".tap "link an account".a plaid disclaimer page will be displayed. tap "continue" after reading.a second plaid disclaimer screen will be displayed.  tap "continue" after reading.tap to select your bank.enter your online credentials.tap "continue".tap on the account you want to link.tap "select".your account is now linked. to transfer funds to your n26 account using the n26 mobile application, follow these steps: launch your n26 mobile application.tap the "actions" button at the bottom right of your mobile‚Äôs screen.tap "add money".tap "external bank transfer".select the account to use to transfer funds from.enter the amount you want to transfer.tap "continue".enter your 4 digit confirmation pin.tap "confirm transfer" to initiate the transfer.a message will be displayed in your transactions list indicating that the transfer has been scheduled.

question: psd2 - secure open banking
answer:
payment services directive 2 (‚Äúpsd2‚Äù) is a revised european directive allowing you to access your account information and initiate payments through regulated third-party providers in a safe and secure manner. 
 
this means that you can permit regulated third party providers to access your account information through a dedicated interface:  you can enable an account information service (ais) to pull together data from different bank accounts you may have, and then aggregate and manage their details in the same place through certified third-party providers.you can securely pay at the checkout of any website that offers payment initiation services (pis).  the data exchange is handled in the background via our partner - token.io. if you begin using a third-party payment service like an account information service or a payment initiation service, you‚Äôll be redirected to your n26 app via token.io to confirm the access request. in our privacy policy(new tab) we inform you about the purposes, involved parties and legal bases of the necessary data processing involved to fulfil our obligations as part of the revised european payment services directive. faqs if a third party provider has not integrated with our dedicated interface, the third party provider will need to integrate with our dedicated interface via our partner token.io. you need to contact the respective third party provider and revoke the access permission directly with them.  *applies to all countries in the eea.

question: how to save the details of a transfer recipient?
answer: every time you make a transfer to a new recipient in the app (tap + then transfer and add new recipient), some details like the recipient‚Äôs name and iban are automatically saved in your transfer contact list for future transfers. you can also delete contacts or view your transaction history with them: ios: swipe a contact entry to the left in order to show the transaction history or delete the entry.android: tap and hold on a contact entry in order to show the transaction history or delete the entry. keep in mind that deleting a contact entry doesn‚Äôt delete your transaction history with them.

question: what are shared spaces?
answer: shared spaces is a new and easy way for n26 users to share money together. these spaces can be used for anything from splitting bills, to planning a vacation or organising a birthday gift for a friend or relative. shared spaces are available to n26 premium users (you / business you / metal), who can both create shared spaces and invite participants to their space. participants can be any n26 account holder regardless of their account type.the owner of the shared space owns the money inside it.the owner can invite up to 10 participants and remove participants for their space. similar to regular spaces, shared spaces have neither an iban nor a card attached to them.

question: are n26 accounts fdic-insured?
answer: yes - n26 accounts are fdic-insured through our partner bank, axos bank¬Æ, member fdic. this means that deposits in n26 accounts are insured up to $250,000.  please note that all deposit accounts of the same ownership and/or vesting held at axos bank¬Æ are combined and insured under the same fdic certificate 35546, and that all deposit accounts through axos bank¬Æ brands are not separately insured by the fdic from other deposit accounts held with the same ownership and/or vesting at axos bank¬Æ.  this means that if you have an axos bank¬Æ account (non-n26) in addition to an n26 account, the total coverage will be $250,000.

question: cashback perks
answer:
"how do i sign up for cashback on subscriptions?" signing up for cashback perks is simple and is accomplished via the mobile app. on launching the app, tap on the "explore" tab.once in the explore page, tap on the "manage" button, this will take you to the cashback on subscriptions page.once in the cashback subscriptions page you can select your cashback perk by tapping on the appropriate partner.   "the cashback perk that i previously subscribed to is no longer applicable to me, how do i unsubscribe from that perk?" when a cashback perk is no longer applicable to your lifestyle, you can easily unsubscribe from it via the mobile or web app. on launching the app, tap on the "explore" tab.once in the explore page, tap on the "manage" button, this will take you to the cashback on subscriptions pageonce in the cashback subscriptions page you can select your cashback perk to unsubscribe from by tapping on the appropriate partner.   "how many cashback perks can i subscribe to?" you can only subscribe to one cashback perk at a time. your lifestyle and situation will be your guide as to which one to subscribe to.
 "is there a cost to subscribing?" no, there is no cost to subscribing to a perk. in fact, these perks are here to save you money. 
 "does this work for any subscription, i.e. family plans?" no, only monthly plans for one user are eligible for monthly cashback perks.  "what payment method do i have to use in order to get a cashback or a discount perk?" you must pay for your purchase directly with your n26 visa debit card, if another form of payment is used, the cashback or discount will not be applied.  to ensure that you get the benefit you deserve, you may have to go into your account and verify that the card on file, and being charged, is your n26 visa debit card. transactions made through third parties or with electronic wallets such as apple pay and google pay are not eligible for discounts or cashback under our perks program. 
 "how many days after making a qualifying payment would i receive cashback for a monthly cashback perk?" approximately two business days.   "will the cashback appear as a statement credit?  if so, when?" yes, if applicable, the cashback will appear on your transaction list as ‚Äòmonthly perk‚Äô.  the cashback benefit is applied as soon as your payment for the monthly subscription comes through, which is typically the billing date of the subscription.
 "who are your current perks partners?" to further enhance your n26 experience, we are constantly adding new partners, to see the current list of perks partners, please go to your n26 app.
 "how much cash back does the customer receive on a subscription per month for cashback on subscriptions perks?  is it a specific dollar amount, or a percentage of the subscription charge?  please list subscriptions and specific percentages of cashback." in order to see exactly how much cashback you can get on your subscription, please go to your n26 app. the percentage of cash back varies depending on the partner.  "is there a date by which i must enroll in perks in order to receive cash back?" no. you can enroll in perks whenever you want.  "does the cashback offer have a termination period?" cashback perk offers do not have a termination period.  unless there is a specific ‚Äúvalid until‚Äù date is shown, n26 can terminate the offer at any time.

question: bin ich in den usa steuerpflichtig?
answer: als lizenzierte bank sind wir gem√§√ü fatca verpflichtet, dem ‚Äúinternal revenue service‚Äù (irs) alle konten zu melden, die von personen gef√ºhrt werden, die in den usa steuerpflichtig sind. dieses gesetz wurde vom amerikanischen finanzministerium verabschiedet, um eine bessere einhaltung von steuervorschriften zu erreichen. so soll verhindert werden, dass amerikanische staatsangeh√∂rige ausl√§ndische banken und andere finanzinstitute dazu verwenden, steuern auf ihr einkommen und kapital zu vermeiden.  mehr informationen zu fatca findest du hier.(neuen tab) laut fatca ist ein amerikanischer staatsangeh√∂riger unter anderem so definiert: staatsangeh√∂riger der usa (auch bei doppelter staatsangeh√∂rigkeit)einwohner der usa, beispielsweise inhaber einer g√ºltigen u.s. greencard oder person, die den ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù erf√ºllt (siehe unten). falls du dir nicht sicher bist, ob du ein amerikanischer staatsangeh√∂riger bist, wende dich bitte an einen steuerberater. ‚Äúsubstantial presence test‚Äù bedeutet: du warst im aktuellen kalenderjahr 183 oder mehr tage in den usa physisch anwesend. oder du warst innerhalb der letzten 3 kalenderjahre 183 tage in den usa physisch anwesend. (31 tage oder mehr im aktuellen kalenderjahr) + (anzahl der tage, die du im letzten jahr in den usa physisch anwesend warst) geteilt durch 3 + (anzahl der tage, die du im vorletzten jahr in den usa physisch anwesend warst) geteilt durch 6.  dar√ºber hinaus auch, wenn dein konto die diese angaben enth√§lt: us-amerikanische staatsangeh√∂rigkeit oder wohnsitz in den usageburtsort in den usapostanschrift oder postfach in den usaus-amerikanische rufnummerdauerauftr√§ge an eine us-amerikanischen adresse oder ein konto, das in den usa verwaltet wird f√ºr den fall, dass wir folgende dokumente nicht von dir erhalten, sind wir weiterhin dazu verpflichtet, dich als us staatsangeh√∂rigen anzusehen: ein w-8ben formular oder eine √§hnliche eigenerkl√§rung undeinen nicht us-amerikanischen pass oder einen anderen regierungsamtlichen ausweis, der deine staatsangeh√∂rigkeit oder nationalit√§t eines anderen landes als den usa nachweist.falls du in den usa geboren bist, eine kopie der best√§tigung √ºber den verlust deiner staatsb√ºrgerschaft.

question: spazi condivisi - il beneficiario fidato
answer: il beneficiario fidato di uno spazio condiviso pu√≤: trasferire denaro dai propri spazi (inclusi gli spazi condivisi di cui √® partecipante) a uno spazio condiviso.accedere e liberamente trasferire fondi presenti su uno spazio condiviso.abbandonare uno spazio condiviso in qualunque momento. i trasferimenti tra un beneficiario fidato e uno spazio condiviso non hanno bisogno di essere autenticati tramite notifiche pin e push. i beneficiari possono facilmente trascinare denaro tramite app (mobile e web), cos√¨ come con gli spazi non condivisi. le leggi bancarie europee regolano le modalit√† secondo cui un trasferimento bancario possa essere autorizzato. nell‚Äôambito di queste leggi, la sca (strong customer authentication) definisce i requisiti per rendere i pagamenti online pi√π sicuri. un‚Äôeccezione ai requisiti sca pu√≤ avvenire se un partecipante di uno spazio condiviso viene classificato come ‚Äùbeneficiario fidato‚Äù. scopri di pi√π

question: how much does an n26 account cost?
answer: an n26 bank account is free.* additional charges may apply, depending on your region: pricing in germany(new tab)pricing in austria(new tab)pricing in france(new tab)pricing in spain(new tab)pricing in italy(new tab)pricing in the rest of europe(new tab) *if we‚Äôre not able to offer you an n26 account based on our minimum requirements(new tab), you may be able to open an n26 flex account.

question: how does n26 business work?
answer: ‚ÑπÔ∏è applies to austria, belgium, denmark, estonia, finland, france, germany, greece, iceland, ireland, italy, liechtenstein, luxembourg, the netherlands, norway, poland, portugal, slovakia, slovenia, spain, sweden, and switzerland. it‚Äôs not yet possible to switch between accounts so it‚Äôs important to know if n26 business is right for you: the n26 business account is designed for self-employed and freelance users doing business under their own name. that means you can‚Äôt have your company‚Äôs name on the account or card.the n26 business mastercard is intended for business use only. you receive 0.1% cashback every month on all payments made using the card. it‚Äôs currently not possible to have two separate n26 accounts at the same time so if you also need a card for private expenses, we recommend ordering a maestro card (it‚Äôs available in germany, austria, and the netherlands).as with the n26 bank account, the account is free and we cover certain cash withdrawals as part of our fair use policy. unlike other accounts, transfers in foreign currencies aren‚Äôt possible with n26 business within the app. you can visit transferwise(new tab) for this.business to business (b2b) payments are not supported with a n26 business account.  want to tell your friends about us and earn some money? get ‚Ç¨15 for each friend that you successfully refer to n26. learn more about our refer a friend program.

question: what is moneybeam?
answer: moneybeam is a service that allows you to send money to (or receive money from) other n26 members. launch the n26 mobile application.tap the "send money" icon on the home screen. (alternatively, you can tap "actions", where you can find the "send money" button on the next screen.)tap "moneybeam".select the recipient of the moneybeam.enter the amount that you wish to send in dollars and cents and tap "send".enter an optional, brief message to the recipient (max. 135 characters).tap "send".enter your confirmation pin to initiate the transfer.a "confirm moneybeam" screen will be displayed showing the transaction details.if all is in order, tap "confirm" to execute the moneybeam.your home screen will be displayed showing the moneybeam transaction that was just completed. launch the n26 mobile application.tap "add money" on the home screen. (alternatively, you can tap "actions", where you can find the "add money" button on the next screen.)tap the "request from friends" option.select the contact you are requesting a moneybeam from.enter the amount you are requesting in dollars and cents and tap "request". enter an optional, brief message to the person from whom you are requesting money (max. 135 characters).tap "request".your home screen will be displayed once the request has been successfully sent.when the requested moneybeam is sent to you, an entry will be made in your transaction list showing the credited amount. when you receive a moneybeam request from another us n26 customer, you can either accept or reject it.  either way, you will first have to launch the n26 mobile app to see the details of the request. your home screen will be displayed along with a transaction list showing a "pending transaction" (the moneybeam request).tap on the transaction to go to the next screen.the "request details" screen will be displayed.  either accept or decline the request by tapping on the appropriate icon.if you accept the request, you will be taken to the "identity check" screen.enter the 4 digit confirmation pin that you created earlier.  this will initiate the transfer.after entering your confirmation pin, you will be asked a final time to either confirm or delete the transaction.  please note:  once confirmed, the transaction cannot be canceled.after the transfer is complete, your home screen will be displayed with a transaction list showing the funds that were withdrawn from your account. related topics "can i send a moneybeam to a non-n26 customer?" unfortunately, no. moneybeam transfers can only occur between n26 customers. "can i send a moneybeam to a non-us n26 customer?" unfortunately, no. us moneybeam transfers can only be made to fellow us n26 customers. "do i actively have to opt in to use moneybeam?" yes, both parties have to actively opt in to use the moneybeam feature. "are there limits to moneybeam?" yes. the maximum amount that you can transfer is $3,000 (per transaction), $3,000 daily limit (rolling 24 hours), and a $12,000 monthly limit (= per calendar month). "are there fees associated with moneybeam?" no, there are no fees to use moneybeam. "how will this transaction show up in my account?" each moneybeam transaction will show up as a 2 line item in the transaction detail file. one line will have a positive amount, and the other line will have a negative amount depending on who is sending the money (debited) and who is receiving the money (credited). "how can i make sure that i am visible/not visible to all of my contacts?"  that‚Äôs easy! to make sure that you are visible/not visible: go to üë§my account in the application.select "settings"‚Üí"personal settings"‚Üí"personal information". to allow other n26 users in your contact list to find you for easier transfers, make sure the toggle switch at the bottom of the screen is activated. to be invisible, simply deactivate the switch. "why can‚Äôt i see other n26 users on moneybeam?" if you don‚Äôt see a friend on moneybeam but you know they are an n26 user: they most likely haven‚Äôt made themselves visible. please share the process above with them.make sure your friend‚Äôs contact number/email is the same as the one associated with their n26 account.

question: why did my sepa transfer fail?
answer: we accept transfers in eur done via sepa. we don‚Äôt support swift so if you need to make a foreign currency transfer, please use transferwise (in the app or from their website(new tab)). to get a transfer, you‚Äôll only need to provide the sender with your full name (as it‚Äôs written on the id you provided for verification) and your iban. you can find your iban on your balance statements and in üë§ my account (in the mobile app or webapp(new tab)). common reasons for failed transfers: the recipient‚Äôs name on the transfer order is different from the name on their account (must be their name as written on their id).the recipient‚Äôs name is a company name instead of a personal/account name (applies to n26 business).the iban is incorrect.you‚Äôre not receiving the push message to confirm your transfer.an inappropriate use was found. n26 has the responsibility to run routine checks on transactions (see gwg ¬ß 10(new tab)). as a result, we may ask for documentation to verify the origin or source of these transactions. this can result in the credit being delayed or not taking place.

question: how to log in with two factor authentication?
answer: two-factor authentication is an authentication process based on the use of two or more secure elements. you‚Äôre probably familiar with using only  your personal password to sign in to your account, but with two-factor authentication you‚Äôll need either confirmation from a paired device or an sms code. go here for more information on two-factor authentication when you log into your n26 account from the web app or a non-paired device, you‚Äôll be asked to confirm a push notification on your paired device or, if this isn‚Äôt possible, you can request an sms code to be sent to your registered number, confirming your login attempt. this ensures that only you can log in to your n26 account. when you log into your n26 account from your paired device, two-factor authentication is already in motion. this means the process of logging into your n26 account from your paired device stays the same. first, you‚Äôll need to update your phone‚Äôs operating system and the n26 app to their latest versions. if you‚Äôre unable to login to your account, but still have access to your registered email address, try to reset your password. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered email address, please contact us via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out. read more in our article on how to create a password. if you‚Äôve lost access to your paired device, but you still have access to your registered phone number, you‚Äôll be able to log into your n26 account and request an authentication code. to do this: login to the webappwhen prompted to confirm your login on your paired device, select helpchoose send sms codeonce you receive the sms code, input it into the webapp as you‚Äôve just confirmed the authentication code you‚Äôve successfully completed two-factor authentication, and can now pair your new device with your account. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered phone number ‚Äì either because you have a new phone number, or your phone was lost or stolen ‚Äì please contact our customer service via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out. if you have an older smartphone that doesn‚Äôt support the latest app version, you won‚Äôt be able to access n26 via the mobile app anymore using that phone.  however, you can still use our webapp to view your account, to do this you‚Äôll need to confirm your login attempt via an sms verification code which we‚Äôll send to your account‚Äôs registered phone number. you‚Äôll still be able to complete card transactions and cash withdrawals as normal using your mastercard, but bear in mind that you won‚Äôt be able to perform any bank transfers or payments until you can confirm the transfer within the n26 app. read more in our article on strong customer authentification.

question: fatca - why we require certain information from our customers
answer:
as a financial institution, n26 is required to report information about financial accounts held by u.s. taxpayers or by foreign entities (in which u.s. taxpayers hold a substantial ownership interest according to fatca) to the united states department of treasury and the internal revenue service (‚Äúirs‚Äù). fatca is an acronym for foreign account tax compliance act and is a legislation designed to prevent tax evasion. another purpose of fatca is to encourage better tax compliance by preventing u.s. persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid u.s. taxation on their income and assets. you can find more information about fatca on the irs website(new tab). the u.s. tax system includes u.s. citizens who are not presently residing in the u.s. in comparison. so in order for us to be able to accurately determine whether your account is to be reported to the irs, we‚Äôll need to ask you: are you (also) a citizen or green card holder of the united states? 
are you subject to tax in the u.s?

being ‚Äúsubject to tax‚Äù in the u.s. does not necessarily mean that you‚Äôre also paying personal income tax in the u.s. it means that u.s. tax law requires you to file a tax return and declare your (worldwide) income to the irs, even if you don‚Äôt end up paying any u.s. tax.
if so, what is your u.s. taxpayer identification number?

as a u.s. tin you can either use your u.s. social security number (‚Äússn‚Äù) or your u.s. individual taxpayer identification number (itin). you can find more information about tin on the irs‚Äô website(new tab). additionally, if your account shows: a u.s. place of birth, a u.s. telephone number,a standing order to the u.s. then we are required by fatca legislation to initially assume that you are subject to fatca until you can specifically confirm to us otherwise. in case your circumstances change, you can always update your tax information in the n26 app. to do this, simply log in to the n26 app and go to: my account > settings > personal settings > tax information

question: why didn't an atm give me cash?
answer: it happens: you go to an atm doesn‚Äôt give you cash and, and in some cases, the amount is still deducted from your account. first, check your card limits in your card settings and make sure atm withdrawals are active.make sure that you personal limits are set higher than the amount you want to withdraw.please be aware that you can only withdraw as many funds as you have deposited on your account. otherwise, if you don‚Äôt have an overdraft, the withdrawal will be rejected.the fixed maximum daily (24 hours rolling) limit for withdrawals is 2500‚Ç¨. some atms have their own limits in place, so it can happen that you can‚Äôt withdraw your daily limit at once. if you didn‚Äôt receive cash from the atm, but the amount was still charged from your account, we‚Äôre happy to help you: the amount that was deducted from your balance is only an authorization, meaning that the amount is blocked or reserved to be debited by the merchant. when the merchant debits the amount, it‚Äôs called a settlement of the transaction. if your transaction was not successful the authorization normally expires within a matter of hours - or a maximum of 12 working days - and is then automatically credited to your account again. only in case the transaction has been settled we can charge back the amount from the merchant. you can see whether a transaction has been settled when it appears on your downloadable monthly statement (not only in your transaction list in the app). this means: if the amount appears on your monthly statement and/or hasn‚Äôt been credited back to your account after 12 working days, you can file a chargeback with us. in the meantime, we suggest you try another atm from a different operator. this rarely happens twice in a row.

question: how to log in with two factor authentication?
answer: two-factor authentication is an authentication process based on the use of two or more secure elements. you‚Äôre probably familiar with using only  your personal password to sign in to your account, but with two-factor authentication you‚Äôll need either confirmation from a paired device or an sms code. go here for more information on two-factor authentication when you log into your n26 account from the web app or a non-paired device, you‚Äôll be asked to confirm a push notification on your paired device or, if this isn‚Äôt possible, you can request an sms code to be sent to your registered number, confirming your login attempt. this ensures that only you can log in to your n26 account. when you log into your n26 account from your paired device, two-factor authentication is already in motion. this means the process of logging into your n26 account from your paired device stays the same. first, you‚Äôll need to update your phone‚Äôs operating system and the n26 app to their latest versions. if you‚Äôre unable to login to your account, but still have access to your registered email address, try to reset your password. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered email address, please contact us via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out. read more in our article on how to create a password. if you‚Äôve lost access to your paired device, but you still have access to your registered phone number, you‚Äôll be able to log into your n26 account and request an authentication code. to do this: login to the webappwhen prompted to confirm your login on your paired device, select helpchoose send sms codeonce you receive the sms code, input it into the webapp as you‚Äôve just confirmed the authentication code you‚Äôve successfully completed two-factor authentication, and can now pair your new device with your account. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered phone number ‚Äì either because you have a new phone number, or your phone was lost or stolen ‚Äì please contact our customer service via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out. if you have an older smartphone that doesn‚Äôt support the latest app version, you won‚Äôt be able to access n26 via the mobile app anymore using that phone.  however, you can still use our webapp to view your account, to do this you‚Äôll need to confirm your login attempt via an sms verification code which we‚Äôll send to your account‚Äôs registered phone number. you‚Äôll still be able to complete card transactions and cash withdrawals as normal using your mastercard, but bear in mind that you won‚Äôt be able to perform any bank transfers or payments until you can confirm the transfer within the n26 app. read more in our article on strong customer authentification.

question: why was i charged an atm fee?
answer: atm fees could happen for a few reasons:  a ‚Ç¨2 fee applies to any additional withdrawal beyond our fair use policy. you can identify this fee in your transaction history as a separate transaction. we‚Äôll remind you via push message when you‚Äôre running low on free withdrawals. some atms may come with their own fees. this fee will appear within the same transaction in your transaction list, that is added on top of the withdrawal amount. we have no control over these fees and can‚Äôt reject or reverse them. you‚Äôll be informed before the end of a withdrawal if additional fees apply and will have the possibility of cancelling it.foreign currency atm withdrawals sometimes include fees. with the n26 account, there‚Äôs a fee of 1.7% of the withdrawal amount. this fee is waived for n26 you or n26 metal members. using your maestro for atm withdrawals. a ‚Ç¨2 fee applies to both domestic or international withdrawals. maestro is only available in germany, austria, or the netherlands.  good to know: to avoid certain fees, especially when travelling, you can use the(new tab) mastercard atm locator(new tab) to find free atms nearby by selecting no access fee.all atms that you can see in the atm finder support mastercard.you can find an overview of our plans and fees on our website(new tab).

question: what to do if my n26 iban is not accepted?
answer: your iban includes the 2 digit country code (e.g. de), a two-digit check number, the eight-digit bank sort code, and your ten-digit account number. for example: de xx 10011001 26xxxxxxxx. the participating countries of the sepa area (single euro payments area) have agreed on the iban system in order to simplify national and international payments, and to reduce the risk of error in the communication and processing of transactions. merchants or employers who do not accept ibans from other member states of the european economic area are violating european law as of 1 february 2016 (article 9 of regulation no 260/2012(new tab)). if you are ever affected by iban discrimination, please contact your relevant national authority(new tab) directly and notify them. provide your contact details, the name of the merchant or company that didn‚Äôt accept your iban, as well as a brief description of the incident (including a screenshot of the rejection or other documentation of your communication with them).

authentication is already in motion. therefore, the process of logging into your n26 account from your paired device stays the same. sca is being introduced as part of the revised european payments services directive (psd2) which applies to all european banks. the objective of psd2 is to enhance the security of the customers‚Äô data and account security. find out more about psd2 in our dedicated paired device, select help choose send sms codeonce you receive the sms code, input it into the webapp as you confirm the authentication code you‚Äôve completed two-factor authentication and you‚Äôll be able to pair your new device with your account again. if you don‚Äôt have access to your registered phone number - either because you have a new phone number or your phone was lost or stolen - please contact our customer service via live chat and we‚Äôll be glad to help you out.  if you have an older smartphone device that doesn‚Äôt support the latest app version,  you won‚Äôt be able to question: how to file a complaint?
answer:
looking for support or have a question if you don‚Äôt wish to make a complaint but you have questions about our products or need help with your account, we‚Äôre always happy to assist. you can email us at support@n26.com(new tab) (new tab), or just open a chat with us directly within the mobile app or webapp, that‚Äôs the fastest and simplest way to get in touch. raising a complaint we‚Äôre sorry you feel the need to raise a complaint, please see below for the ways you are able to do this. if you are dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can send us an email from your registered email address* or send your complaint via post to the address to: n26 bank gmbh ‚Äì complaint management
klosterstra√üe 62, 10179 berlin, germany to submit your complaint via email please write to the following email address beschwerden@n26.com (new tab)(new tab).  alternatively you can request to raise a complaint via our live support team and they will be happy to assist. when filing a complaint, please always include: your full name email and home addressthe product or service you‚Äôre unhappy happy witha description of your complaint and when this occurred. you can also include any supporting documentation you have in relation to your complaint  we‚Äôll contact you via email to confirm that we‚Äôve received your complaint and then begin our investigation. in case we need more information from you, our complaint management department will reach out directly via email with an explanation of the information required. once our complaint management department has investigated your concerns we will provide you with a final decision via email. if you are unhappy with the outcome of your complaint if you are not satisfied with the resolution provided, you can escalate your complaint to an independent third party. for example: an arbitration body is available to you at the german federal bank (deutsche bundesbank)or you could file a complaint with the german federal financial supervisory authority (bundesanstalt f√ºr finanzdienstleistungsaufsicht ‚Äì bafin)  the european commission has also set up the online dispute resolution platform to help consumers dispute out of court. we are committed to constantly improving our products and services and your feedback makes this possible. should you wish to provide us with feedback regarding anything, please write to us at ideas@n26.com(new tab) (new tab). * we can only discuss account related matters from an email address registered with the n26 account
